Joao se encuentra casado y tiene 1 hijo de 5 meses de nacido a quien le ha querido brindar todo lo necesario. En búsqueda de mejores oportunidades económicas, Joao llegó al municipio de Marinilla hace aproximadamente 4 meses ya que sus suegros se lo recomendaron y allí montó un negocio de comidas rápidas para generar ingresos con los cuales su familia pueda tener una mejor calidad de vida. Debido a que su negocio lo montó con muy bajo capital, aún le hace falta comprar algunas cosas que requiere para preparar los productos como pizzas, hamburguesas y otros más, es por esto que ahora que ve que su negocio esta saliendo adelante que busca que un préstamo le permita comprar insumos para la preparación de las comidas rápidas y comprar utensilios de trabajo necesarios para seguir desempeñando su actividad.

De esta manera su negocio podrá seguir saliendo adelante, y además de esto podrá comenzar a ofrecer mayor variedad de productos diversificando su oferta. Su sueño es sacar su negocio adelante y que este le permita generar ingresos con los cuales su familia pueda acceder a una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en:
Joao’s married and has a five-month-old son who he wants to provide with everything necessary.  Seeking better economic opportunities, Joao came to the municipality of Marinilla about four months ago because his in-laws recommended it to him and he set up a fast-food business there to generate income so that his family could have a better quality of life.

Because he set his business up with little capital he still needs to buy some things he needs to prepare products like pizzas, hamburgers and others which is why now that he sees that his business is getting along he wants to find a loan that will allow him to buy ingredients to prepare the fast food and to buy work utensils to continue carrying out his activity.

In this way his business will be able to continue moving ahead and in addition to this he will be able to start to offer a wider variety of products diversifying his offer.  His dream is to move his business forward so that it will allow him to generate income with which his family can access a better quality of life and better economic opportunities for progress.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and utensils.

loans.name: Saifiddin

texts.ru: Сайфиддин трудолюбивый и добрый человек, он женат и на воспитании имеет  пятерых детей. С малых лет он любил пасти скот и старался стать фермером. Двенадцать лет назад он купил скот и выращивал его. Он закупает крупный и мелкий рогатый скот на рынке Дупулла, перевозит их в горы на пастбище и в течении месяца откармливает затем продает за выгодную цену. Его жена помогает ему в уходе за скотом. Сайфиддин хотел бы получить займ для покупки 5 голов крупного рогатого скота с целью расширения бизнеса. Он надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие.
texts.en: Saifiddin is a hard-working and kind man. He is married and is bringing up five children. Since his youth he has enjoyed grazing livestock and tried to become a farmer. Twelve years ago he bought livestock and began rearing it. He purchases cattle, sheep, and goats at a Dupulla market, transports them to the pastures in the mountains, fattens them there for a month, then sells them for a profitable price. His wife helps him to take care of the livestock. Saifiddin would like to receive a loan to purchase 5 heads of cattle to expand his business.  He is hoping for your help and kindness.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Gs Fray Lazaro Ii Group

texts.es:
La señora  Norma de 59 años de edad es madre soltera tiene su casa propia, comparte su casa con una hija y su nieta, es la líder del grupo solidario FRAY LAZARO # 02, se dedica a la comercialización golosinas, como papas, mango maduros, y verdes, pescado seco, también vende ropa interior y plásticos como ser. Cubetas, pailas, basureros, etc.
Doña Norma solicita el préstamo para comprar verduras, plásticos, ropa interior para comercializar  par los días de la madre, y así pretende tener mejores ganancias para salir adelante con su familia.
Esta muy contenta de seguir trabajando con PRISMA al igual que sus compañeros de grupo desea tener una experiencia mas con prisma y ella esta contenta de formar parte de este  grupo.
El sueño de Doña Norma es aumentar más su negocio y mejorar su casa.
Juan se dedica a tiempo completo a su negocio
Delsy también se dedica a su negocio a tiempo completo ya que es su fuente de ingresos.
En la fotgrafia aparece un amigo del grupo quien se retiro por motivos personales del grupo.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Abril 2012
texts.en:
Norma is 59 years old and a single mother. She owns a home which she shares with her daughter and granddaughter, and she is the leader of the solidarity group Fray Lazaro # 02. She works selling foods such as potatoes, ripe and green mangoes, and dried fish. She also sells underwear and plastic products such as pails, bowls, trash bins, etc.
Norma is requesting the loan in order to purchase vegetables, plastic products, and underwear to sell for Mothers' Day. This way, she hopes to obtain better profits so that she can get ahead with her family.
She is very happy to continue working with PRISMA, as well as the other members in her group. She wants to have another experience with PRISMA and is happy to be a part of this group. 
Norma's dream is to increase her business and improve her home. 

Juan works on his business full time.
Delsy also works on hers business full time, because it is her source of income.
The picture shows a friend of the group who left the group for personal reasons.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - April, 2012

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, plastic products, and underwear to sell at her business.

loans.name: Heriberto

texts.es:
Heriberto es padre soltero de su hijo de 15 años debido a que la madre de su hijo los abandonó desde hace un tiempo sin hacer alguna contribución económica para su sostenimiento, y para generar sus ingresos tenía un empleo en el cual le pagaban un dinero insuficiente para poder sostener los gastos de su hogar. Fue entonces con el ánimo de independizarse económicamente y lograr tener una mejor calidad de vida que montó una tienda general donde ofrece productos de la canasta familiar. Debido a que su tienda la montó con muy bajo capital, sus estanterías son pedazos de madera y su surtido no es muy variado, sin embargo, gracias a su buena atención ha logrado captar una buena cantidad de clientes. Es por esto que ahora que sus ventas vienen mejorando, Heriberto busca que un préstamo le permita comprar productos de la canasta familiar con los que pueda ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos en su tienda y así aumentar sus ventas.

De esta manera sus ingresos se incrementarían permitiéndole tener a el y a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida. Su sueño es llegar a tener muy bien montada su tienda y también ofrecerle a su hijo una educación de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Heriberto is a single dad who has a 15-year-old son. His wife abandoned them some time ago, and does not contribute to helping raise their son. Heriberto was working at a job that did not pay him sufficient income to cover his family’s living expenses, so he decided to open a general store. Since he did not have very much startup capital, his shelves are made out of wooden planks and his inventory is scarce. However, even with these disadvantages, he has still been able to grow his customer base, since he is a kind and hardworking man. As he desires to grow his business and increase his sales volume, Heriberto is requesting this loan, which he plans to put toward the purchase of merchandise to further stock his general store and hopefully increase his sales.  

If he can increase his income, he can offer his son a better quality of life. His dream is to have a well-stocked store, and to provide a high quality education for his son.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for his general store to offer his customers a greater variety of products and increase sales.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
Jorge se encuentra casado y tiene 3 hijos, y para generar los ingresos que se requieren en su hogar tiene un cultivo de verduras el cual vende en la plaza de mercado de su municipio. Gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos, Jorge ha logrado tener muy buena cantidad de clientes que le permiten tener muy buenas ventas, y es por esto que ahora busca incrementar su cultivo buscando un préstamo que le permita comprar abonos, insecticidas y riegos para aumentar el cultivo de productos y así responder a todos los pedidos de sus clientes.

De esta manera su negocio seguirá saliendo adelante, seguirá creciendo y sus ingresos lo harán de la misma manera, permitiendo que su familia tenga mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en:
Jorge’s married and has three children.  In order to generate income needed by his home he grows vegetables to sell in his town’s market square.  

Thanks to the good quality of his products, Jorge has managed to have a very good number of customers which means good sales and this is why he now wants to increase his crops looking for a loan that will make it possible for him to buy manure, insecticide and irrigation to increase his crops of products and thus be able to fill all customer orders.

In this way his business will continue to grow and his income will grow the same way allowing his family to have a better quality of life and greater economic opportunities to make progress.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel se ha dedicado gran parte de su vida a la actividad de la confección, y gracias a esta actividad logró sacar adelante a su hijo ya que era madre cabeza de familia y no tenía más ingresos que su actividad ofreciendo el servicio de confección a terceros. Gracias a la buena calidad de sus trabajos Isabel tiene muy buenos contratos para confeccionar a terceros, además de que también saca una línea de confección propia la cual vende en su municipio. Debido a que tiene grandes pedidos por confeccionar, Isabel busca que un préstamo le permita comprar telas e hilos para confeccionar grandes pedidos que tiene por parte de sus clientes.

De esta manera su negocio seguirá saliendo adelante y así podrá seguir generando ingresos con los cuales pueda seguir sosteniendo los gastos de su hogar. Además, sueña con tener un gran taller de confección donde pueda generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas y así ayudar a prosperar a otros.
texts.en:
Isabel has been a tailor for many years.  Thanks to this she has been able to provide a good life for her son. She is the head of her household, and her sole source of income is her work as a tailor.  Thanks to the high quality of her work, Isabel has very good contracts with her customers.  Further, she has her own clothing line which she sells in her area.  She currently has large orders she needs to fulfill, she is seeking a loan that will allow her to buy cloth and thread to fulfill these orders.

In this way her business will keep growing and thus allow her to make the income necessary to continue to keep up with her household expenses.  Further, she dreams of opening a larger tailoring business where she will be able to create jobs for people who are in greater need and thus help others prosper.

loans.use: to buy cloth and thread to fulfill large orders from her customers.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Por El Progreso Group

texts.es: Domitila de 35 años de edad es conviviente con 04 hijos, actualmente sigue apoyando a 03 de ellos. Domitila empezó vendiendo anticuchos en las afueras de su hogar, poco a poco fue ahorrando y con la ayuda de su pareja decidieron emprender su propio negocio la cual actualmente  cuenta con una bodega en su domicilio, aparte nos manifiesta que brinda servicio de cocina los fines de semana, de donde obtiene un ingreso extra para su hogar. Domitila se siente feliz pues con su trabajo  puede seguir apoyando a su pareja con los gastos del hogar, y mantener su negocio. Su deseo es de seguir creciendo en su negocio. El crédito que solicito lo va a destinar para capital de trabajo la cual comprara  gaseosas, cervezas y abarrotes. Domitila es socia de la Alcancía Comunal “Mujeres Unidas Por El Progreso” la cual está conformado por 09 socios responsables. Ellos agradecen el crédito brindado. En la parte superior esta Guisela.
texts.en:
Domitila, 35, has a spouse and four children; she’s still supporting three of them.  Domitila started out selling 'anticuchos' [grilled, skewered meat] outside her house and gradually saved up and with help from her spouse they decided to start their own business which she now has: a home-based grocery store.  She also mentions that on weekends she provides cooking services where she earns extra income for her home.

Domitila feels happy because she’s able to continue helping her spouse with household expenses with her work and to maintain her business.  Her wish is to continue growing in her business. The loan she requested will be used as working capital; she will buy soft-drinks, beer and groceries.  

Domitila is a member of the “Mujeres Unidas Por El Progreso” (Women United for Progress) communal bank which has nine responsible members.  They are grateful for the loan provided.

Guisela appears in the upper part.

loans.use: to buy beverages and groceries.

loans.name: Ricardo Enrique

texts.es: Ricardo a sus 22 años es soltero y vive en Guayaquil. Su negocio el cual es diseño en camisetas lo inicio hace 2 años. Nos cuenta que fue una idea que le surgió y la aplico. No se queja ya que le va bien. Empezó con pocas camisetas para probar el mercado y poco a poco a ganado aceptación por lo que ahora tiene muchos pedidos. Hasta el momento no a tenido problemas con la delincuencia en su sector ni algún otro percance. Con el préstamo va a comprar moldes y camisetas para sus ventas. Su meta es la expansión para que sus entregas sean por mayor.
texts.en:
Ricardo, 22, is single and lives in Guayaquil. Two years ago, he started his t-shirt design business. He tells us that the idea came to him, and he followed up on it. He can't complain because the business is doing well. He started with a few t-shirts to test the market, and little by little his designs have been accepted as seen by the fact that he has a lot of orders. He hasn't had any problems with crime or other misfortunes in his area. 

With this loan, he is going to buy printing screens and t-shirts to sell. His goal is to expand so that his income is higher.

loans.use: to buy printing screens and t-shirts.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Рустам женат и на воспитании имеет троих детей. Его женат домохозяйка и ухаживает по дому. Более 4 лет Рустам занимается производством сырого кирпича. Он кредитуется в «ИМОН Интершнешнл» уже 5 циклов. Займ помог ему на продвижения своего бизнеса и благодарен за поддержку. Кроме того он занимается купле- продажей крупного рогатого скота. В бизнесе помогает ему его сын. В дальнейшем он мечтает открыть собственный автосервис, который приносит ему дополнительный доход. Данный момент Рустам запрашивает займ для покупки крупного рогатого скота с целью расширения бизнес скотоводства. Рустам надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Rustam is married and is bringing up three children.  His wife is a homemaker and takes care of the house. For over 4 years Rustam has been manufacturing raw bricks. He has received 5 loans through "IMON International". The loans have helped him in developing his business and he is grateful for the support. In addition, he is in business of reselling cattle.  His son helps him with his business.  In the future he is hoping to open his own car service business that will bring him additional income. Currently Rustam is requesting a loan to purchase cattle to expand his cattle rearing business.  Rustam is hoping for your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Unidas Para Vencer Group

texts.es: Doña Ada tiene 43 años de edad, es miembro del Grupo Solidario Unidas para Vencer, es casada y tiene dos hijos, su esposo es comerciante, ellos residen en la comunidad de San Nicolás, de la ciudad de Juticalpa, Departamento de Olancho. Doña Ada se dedica a la venta de verduras, frutas y golosinas, desde hace algunos años se dedica a esta actividad y le ha resultado muy rentable, trabaja en conjunto con su esposo, su horario de atención es de 6:00 am hasta las 6:00 pm. La ventaja es que tiene muchos clientes y el negocio le deja ganancias para cubrir sus gastos. El préstamo que doña Ada esta solicitando lo necesita para invertirlo en la compra de frutas y verduras. Con la ayuda de este préstamo podrá tener mejor surtido su negocio. Su meta es lograr tener un negocio más grande, bien surtido y obtener un local más amplio. Doña Ada es cliente de FAMA desde hace 9 ciclos y hasta la actualidad ha sido puntual con sus cuotas de pagos.
texts.en:
Ada, 43, is a member of the “Unidas Para Vencer” (United to Be Victorious) communal bank.  She’s married and has two children; her husband’s a merchant.  They live in the community of San Nicolás in the city of Juticalpa, Olancho Department.

Ada has sold fruit, vegetables and snacks for several years, an activity that has turned out to be very profitable.  She works with her husband and their schedule is 6am to 6pm.  Her advantage is that she has many customers and the business generates profits to cover her costs.

The loan Ada is asking for is to buy fruit and vegetables.  With help from this loan she will have her business better stocked.  Her goal is to have a larger, well-stocked business and to get a larger locale.

Ada has been a FAMA client for nine cycles and to date has been punctual with her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Celia Marisella

texts.es: Celia vive en Paraiso y tiene 36 años. Tiene una papelería en su casa con el cual mantiene su economía. Nos cuenta que el negocio lo inicio por la necesidad al salir embarazada. Era su segundo hijo y no tenía quien se lo cuidara. Con este negocio puede atenderlos sin problemas y gastos adicionales. Atiende sola de 7:30 de la mañana hasta las 10:30 de la noche. Es madre soltera de 2 niños de 10 y 9 años que van a la escuela. El préstamo lo utilizara para la compra de cuadernos, láminas, cartulina, hojas etc. Su meta es ampliar el negocio y comprar una copiadora. Suerte Celia.
texts.en:
Celia lives in Paraiso and is 36 years old. She has a stationery store in her house that supports her financially. She tells us she started the business because she became pregnant with her second child and had no one to look after him. With this business, she can easily take care of the children and pay the additional expenses. She works alone from 7:30 in the morning until 10:30 at night. She is the single mother of two children, ages 10 and 9, who attend school. 

She will use the loan to buy notebooks, plastic sheets, cards, paper, etc. Her goal is to expand her business and buy a copier. Good luck, Celia.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, plastic sheets, cards, and paper.

loans.name: Carlos Luis

texts.es: Carlos tuvo sus inicios en la venta de artículo para el hogar desde muy joven. Empezó recorriendo las calles de la ciudad ofertando sus productos. Con los años reunió un capital y estableció en su casa el negocio. Lo maneja solo de lunes a viernes desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. Los fines de semana por lo general se traslada  a la costa con la venta. Como realiza viajes su mayor preocupación es la delincuencia y el mal estado de los caminos. Es soltero pero tiene 3 hijos de 15, 7 y 5 años a los que apoya en los estudios escolares. Con el crédito comprara peluches, cuadernos, cosméticos. A futuro le gustaría construir la segunda planta en su casa.
texts.en: Carlos got his start selling household items from the time he was very young.  He started by going out into the streets of the city, offering his products for sale.  Over the years, he gathered together some capital and set up a business in his house.  He manages it by himself Mondays through Fridays, from 9am until 6pm.  He usually spends the weekends bringing products from the coast to sell.  On his trips, his main worries are crime and the bad road conditions.  He is single, but has 3 children aged 15, 7 and 5 who he supports in their education.  With this loan, he will buy stuffed animals, notebooks and cosmetics.  In the future, he would like to add a second story to his house.

loans.use: to buy stuffed animals, notebooks and cosmetics

loans.name: Garukirabakenyezi Group

texts.fr:
Sophie fait partie du groupe Garukirabakenyezi  et habite à Gitega. C’est une veuve de 49ans.  Elle a 5 enfants, âgés  de 17 à 25 ans, dont 1 étudie.

Elle fait le commerce de manioc et de la bière de banane depuis  19 ans. 

Elle est à son dix-huitième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de manioc à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Les gains de son commerce, lui permettent de payer les frais de scolarité de son enfant , les soins de santé et supporter d’autres charges.
texts.en:
Sophie is a member of the Garukirabakenyezi group and lives in Gitega.  She is a 49-year-old widow, and has five children, ages 17 to 25.  One of her children is in school.

Sophie has been selling cassava and banana beer for the past 19 years.

This is her 18th loan with Turame.  With her Kiva loan, she will increase her capital and buy a large quantity of cassava for resale, in order to make more money.

Earnings from her business will help her to pay the tuition fees for her child, to cover healthcare costs, and to take care of other expenses.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of cassava for resale.

loans.name: Gs 16 De Abril Group

texts.es:
El Señor Ricardo, tiene 40 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos, Su actividad principal es la venta de frutas de temporada y pan Orneado, tiene  6 años de experiencia en el manejote su negocio, el cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa, Don Ricardo esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de frutas como ser: naranjas, mandarinas, aguacates, piñas, ciruelas, mangos, sandias, melones y otros productos para la elaboración del pan orneado, para la buena atención de sus clientes, ya que al tener su negocio ubicado en la calle principal de la comunidad donde el vive le facilita sus ventas, al tener una mejor clientela, Don Ricardo también vende de manera ambulante, en su bicicleta, en algunas comunidades de la zona, el es una persona muy trabajadora y ha sabido salir adelante con su negocio que ha sido la única fuente de ingresos, con el apoyo solicitado del préstamo que reciba Don Ricardo, le contribuirá a tener un mejor negocio, y así obtener mejores ingresos para cubrir los gastos en el hogar y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
El sueño de Don Ricardo es tener una motocicleta, para vender mas producto en otras comunidades.
La Señora Sara, se dedica al comercio, su actividad principal es la venta de  golosinas Nacatamales.
El Señor Antonio, se dedica al comercio, su actividad principal es la venta granos Básicos “maíz y frijoles” El cuenta con12 años de experiencia, tiene 3 hijos. 
Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - Abril 2012
texts.en:
Ricardo is 40 years old and has three children. His main activity is selling seasonal fruit and oven-baked bread. He has six years of experience managing his business and counts on his wife's support.
Ricardo is requesting the loan in order to purchase fruit, such as oranges, tangerines, avocados, pineapple, plums, mangoes, watermelon, melon, and other products to make oven-baked bread, so that he can offer his customers good service. Since his business is located on the main street in the community where he lives, this makes sales easier by creating a broader customer base. 
Ricardo also sells his products on the street, going out on his bicycle to several communities in the area. He is a very hard worker and has found a way to move forward with his business, which has been his only source of income. The support afforded by this loan will help Ricardo have a better business so that he can earn a better income to cover home expenses and give his family a better quality of life.
Ricardo's dream is to have a motorcycle so that he can sell more products in other communities.

Sara works selling mainly the food "nacatamales."
Antonio works selling mainly basic grains, rice, and beans. He has twelve years of experience and has three children. 

Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - April, 2012

loans.use: to purchase fruit such as oranges, tangerines, avocados, pineapple, plums, mangoes, watermelon, melon, and other products for his business.

loans.name: Las Triunfadoras De Huampani Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Las Triunfadoras De Huampani” es un grupo conformado por 08 personas responsables y comprometidas con el Programa-Prosperidad, siendo la gran mayoría vecinos de la zona. Seferina tiene 55 años de edad es casada con 05 hijos independientes y ella es la que preside al grupo. Seferina se dedica a la venta de comidas la cual lleva más de 01 años en dicho negocio. Gracias a su trabajo a podido mejorar su vivienda y apoyar con los gastos del hogar. Actualmente apoya a una de sus hijas. Su mayor deseo es de tener un local en un lugar céntrico donde pueda ofrecer sus comidas. En esta oportunidad solicito el crédito para la compra de un carrito sanguchero, pues piensa emprender su nuevo negocio de ventas de frituras. La Alcancía Comunal “Las Triunfadoras De Huampani” están agradecidos con el crédito brindado. Seferina se encuentra ubicada en la parte  de adelante y viste un polo color azul.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Las Triunfadoras De Huampani” is a group that comprises 8 responsible people who are committed to Programa-Prosperidad. Most of the group are neighbors from the area. Seferina, 55, is married, has 5 independent children, and heads the group. For more than a year, Seferina has been selling food as her business. The work has helped her improve her home and pay her household expenses. Now she is helping one of her daughters. 

Her greatest wish is to have a centrally-located space where she can offer her food. At this time, she is requesting a loan to buy a sandwich cart as she is thinking of starting a new business selling fried foods. The communal bank “Las Triunfadoras De Huampani” is grateful for the credit extended to the members. Seferina is seated at the front of the photo and is wearing a blue t-shirt.

loans.use: to buy a sandwich cart.

loans.name: Olinda Magali

texts.es: Olinda tiene 40 años y vive en el Suburbio parte sur urbana de Guayaquil. Empezó su negocio ingresando en diferentes cursos de manualidades, primero fue en fomix luego de cerámica. Lo hizo porque le gusta pero cuando su esposo la abandono inicio el negocio por la necesidad de ingresos para sus gastos. El trabajo lo realiza sola pero en ocasiones le ayuda una amiga con la cerámica. Como su sector en un poco peligroso si le preocupa la delincuencia pero hasta nuestra entrevista no había tenido ningún problema. Vive con sus hijos que tienen  15 y 17 años y asisten al colegio fiscal. Con el préstamo va a comprar perlas, chaquiras, fomix, pintura. Sus metas y sueños es tener un local donde exponer sus productos para mejorar sus ventas
texts.en:
Olinda, 40, lives in Suburbio in the southern part of Guayaquil.  She started her business by taking several manual arts classes, first in Foamy and then in ceramics.  She did it because she likes it but when her husband abandoned her she started the business because of the need for income to cover her expenses.  She does the work alone but sometimes a girlfriend helps with the ceramics.  

Because her neighborhood is a bit dangerous she does worry about crime but up to our interview she’d had no problems of any kind.  She lives with her children who are 15 and 17 years old and attend public school.  

She will use the loan to buy pearls, sequins, Foamy and paint.  Her goals and dreams are to have a locale in which to display her products in order to improve her sales.

loans.use: to buy crafts supplies.

loans.name: Isabel Beronica

texts.es: Isabel tiene un negocio de venta de manualidad en Fomix. Siempre le a gustado las manualidades por ese motivo decidió vender sorpresas para cumpleaños. Como es madre soltera esto le permite cuidar de sus hijos y mantener su hogar. Su horario de atención es de 7 de la mañana a 11 de la noche de lunes a sábados. Isabel nos cuenta que si tiene problemas en el invierno ya que bajan sus ventas por el daño que sufren las calles de su barrio lo que impide la movilización. Tiene 2 hijos de 7 y 11 años que asisten a la escuela. El préstamo lo implementara en la compra de materiales para su negocio como fomix, pintura y moldes. Su meta próxima es ampliar su negocio construyendo en un espacio baldío que tiene en su casa.
texts.en:
Isabel has a business making crafts and foam art. She has always liked hands-on work, a trend that has led her to sell crafts for birthday parties and surprises. She is a single mother, and provides her family's only source of income. She works from 7:00 am until 11:00 pm, Monday through Saturday. Her sales are typically down in winter, since streets are less navigable due to bad weather, and less people are out and about. 

She has two children, ages 7 and 11, both of whom are in school. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase materials for making her crafts, including foam, paint and molds. One of her goals is to convert an empty space she has in her house into a larger workshop for her business.

loans.use: to purchase foam, paint and molds.

loans.name: Gs Las Delicias Group

texts.es:
La  Señora Santos, tiene 60 años de edad, tiene 1 hijo y es madre soltera, Su actividad principal es la venta de abarrotería (pulpería) desde hace más de 5 Años, Doña Santos, esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de productos como: azúcar, manteca, jabón, refrescos, carnes, papel higiénico, maíz, frijoles y otros productos para la buena atención de sus clientes, ya que al tener su negocio ubicado en su hogar le permite realizar a su vez oficios domésticos sin descuidar su hogar y de esta manera también puede atender a sus clientes, con el apoyo solicitado del préstamo que reciba Doña Santos, le contribuirá a tener un mejor negocio, y así obtener mejores ingresos para cubrir los gastos en el hogar y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, y ayudarla a salir adelante, ella trabaja afanosamente  para manejar todo en orden en su hogar y negocio.
Doña Santos uno de sus sueños es ampliar su  negocios y vender una variedad de producto, gracias al apoyo que se le brinde subiría un peldaño para lograr su sueño.
La Señora Haydee, se dedica al comercio, su actividad principal es la venta de Cosméticos.
La Señora Maritza, se dedica al comercio y su actividad principal es la venta de granos básicos.
Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - Abril 2012
texts.en:
Santos is 60 years old, has one son, and is a single mother. Her main activity for more than five years has been selling groceries at her small store. Santos is applying for the loan to buy products such as sugar, lard, soap, soft drinks, meats, toilet paper, corn, beans, and other products for serving her customers well. 

Having her business located in her home allows her to carry out household chores at the same time. This way she can also serve her customers without neglecting her household. 

With the support requested through the loan that Santos will receive, she will invest in having a better business and so earn better income. This is so that she can cover the household expenses, give her family a better quality of life and help them succeed. She works tirelessly to keep everything in order in her household and business.

One of Santos' dreams is to expand her businesses, and sell a variety of products. Thanks to the support she has been offered, she will climb a step toward achieving her dream.

Haydee has a small retail business, and her main activity is selling cosmetics.

Maritza has a small retail business, and her main activity is selling staple grains.

Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - April 2012

loans.use: To buy sugar, lard, soap, soft drinks, meats, toilet paper, corn, beans and other products for her business.

loans.name: Jaime Alberto

texts.es:
Jaime es una persona muy trabajadora y para generar los ingresos para su hogar donde convive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos aprendió empíricamente la actividad de la venta de frutas y verduras en la plaza de mercado de su municipio. Hace un tiempo que Jaime tiene su puesto de venta de frutas y verduras y gracias a la buena atención que ofrece sus clientes cada vez van en aumento, es por esto que busca un préstamo que le permita comprar surtido de frutas y verduras y unas canastas para organizar las frutas y las verduras en su negocio.

De esta manera podrá seguir ofreciendo una buena variedad de productos a sus clientes haciendo que cada vez su negocio sea más atractivo. Además, espera que sus ingresos aumenten considerablemente permitiéndole brindar en su hogar una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar. Su sueño es crecer con su negocio y expandirlo para generar empleo para los más necesitados.
texts.en:
Jaime is a very hardworking person.  In order to provide for his wife and four children, he has learned by trial and error the business of selling fruits and vegetables in his local market.  He has had his stall for some time now, and thanks to the good service he provides to his customers, his business has steadily grown.  It is for this reason that he is seeking a loan that will allow him to supply his business with more fruits and vegetables and some baskets to organize these items.

In this way he will be able to continue to offer a good variety of products to his customers and make his business more and more attractive.  Further, he hopes that his income will increase considerably, allowing him to bring a better quality of life to his family and better opportunities for economic progress.  His dream is to grow and expand his business to the point where he can create employment for those who need it most.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for his business and some baskets to organize these items.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr:
Koffi est un homme âgé de 35 ans. Il est célibataire et n’a pas d’enfants.
Koffi travaille comme photocopieur. Il fait des saisies de texte depuis 2010. Il exerce son activité dans une boutique à ses clients et sa difficulté est la concurrence sur le terrain . 
Koffi a requis son second  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des machines pour photocopie. Il veut créer un autre centre de traitement de texte. 
Dans les prochaines années, Koffi voudrait créer un centre de cyber , se marier et avoir des enfants.
texts.en:
Koffi is a man aged 35. He is single and has no children. He works as a photocopy-maker and has been doing text input since 2010. He does his work in a shop for his clients and his difficulty is the competition in the field. 

Koffi has requested his second loan from WAGES in order to buy photocopiers. He wants to create another word processing center. In the coming years, Koffi would like to open up an internet center, to marry, and to have children.

loans.use: to buy a photocopier.

loans.name: Alirio Alberto

texts.es:
Alirio ha tenido que atravesar por muchas adversidades en la vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza suficiente para salir adelante y continuar progresando junto con su familia. Luego de buscar por diferentes regiones del país oportunidades laborales, llegó al municipio donde actualmente reside y allí tuvo la oportunidad de montar una tienda general donde ofrece productos de la canasta familiar. Gracias a este negocio genera los ingresos suficientes para poder sostener los gastos de su hogar, por esto siempre lo atiende de la mejor manera posible para que su negocio siga creciendo y cada vez tenga más clientes. Debido a que su negocio lo montó con muy bajo capital, no cuenta con suficiente variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes, es por esto que busca que un préstamo le permita comprar productos de la canasta familiar para ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad de productos y así poder tener unas mejores ventas.

Su sueño es llegar a tener un minimercado donde pueda generar empleo para las demás personas, además de poder brindar a su familia una estabilidad económica y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alirio has had to overcome many adversities in his life, but without a doubt, he has always had enough strength to move on and continue making progress alongside his family.  After looking in different regions of his country for opportunities to work, he arrived in the municipality where he currently resides, and there he was able to open a general store where he sells everyday goods.

Thanks to this business, he makes enough income to support his family, and therefore he always looks after the store in the best possible manner so that his business will continue to grow and have more customers.  Because he started his business with very little capital, he doesn't have enough variety in the products he offers to his customers, and for this reason, he is seeking a loan that will allow him to buy everyday goods to offer his customers a greater variety of products and thus be able to have higher sales.

His dream is to turn his business into a corner grocery store where where he will be able to offer employment to others and also be able to offer his family economic stability and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy everyday items to offer his customers a greater variety of goods and thereby achieve higher sales.

loans.name: Prima

texts.en:
Prima is 36 years old, married and has three children. To make a living, Prima and her husband raise crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice to sell. Her husband goes down to the rice field every day to ensure good crop growth. They have been in their business for almost 10 years and earn P15,000 each harvest season, twice a year. They sell the rice to traders. Their income goes for meals and matriculation fees of their children. 

Prima is now applying for a loan of P30,000 to further improve their farming business. From her loan, she will buy UREA (fertilizer) and five liters of insecticides that will help ensure a healthier growth of crops. Prima promises to pay back her loan in full. She will also be very happy and proud if all her children finish a degree and became professionals in their chosen career someday.

loans.use: to buy UREA (fertilizer) and five liters of insecticides used in farming

loans.name: Edigio

texts.es:
Edigio se encuentra casado y tiene 1 hijo de 7 años de edad, y para generar los ingresos que requiere en su hogar trabaja como celador en una subestación de energía cerca de su municipio, sin embargo, el salario que allí gana no es suficiente para poder sostener los gastos de su hogar, es por esto que quiere iniciarse en la actividad agropecuaria con la producción de leche. La actividad la conoce porque sus padres se dedicaban a esto y así pudo conocerla, por esto, busca que un préstamo le permita comprar una ternera para comenzar su propio negocio de producción de leche.

De esta manera sus ingresos serán mayores permitiendo tener una mejor calidad de vida en su hogar. Su sueño es poder tener un buen negocio, con unos buenos ingresos y así sacar a su familia adelante, brindándoles una buena calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en:
Edigio is married and has a seven-year-old son. To generate the income he needs for his household, he works as a security guard in a power sub-station near his municipality. However the salary that he earns there is not sufficient to support his household expenses. This is the reason he wants to get started in the farming business, with milk production. 

He knows the business because his parents used to work in this, and this way he was able to get to know it. This is why he is seeking a loan that will allow him to buy a calf in order to start his own business in milk production.

This way his income will be greater, allowing him to have a better quality of life in his household. His dream is to be able to have a good business, with good revenues, and in this way help his family get ahead in life, offering them a good quality of life and greater economic opportunities for making progress.

loans.use: To buy a calf, in order to start his own business producing milk.

loans.name: Elvia Piedad

texts.es: Elvia vive en Duran y tiene una tienda de abarrotes. Su tienda la inicio al quedarse viuda. Nos cuenta que no quería verse derrota y sus hijos le dieron fuerza para continuar día a día. Así surgió esta idea la cual fue acertada por cuanto su negocio ha ido creciendo y es muy rentable. Atiende todos los días de la semana, lo realiza sola o con la ayuda de su hija. Por su sector existe la delincuencia con lo que presenta el factor de mayor preocupación. Tiene 3 hijas las cuales son mayores de edad e independientes pero suelen visitarla. Con el crédito comprara arroz, azúcar, víveres, pollo, carne con esto espera aumentar sus ventas. En próximos años le gustaría comprar un vehículo que le sirva para transportarse a la hora de comprar la mercadería.
texts.en:
Elvia lives in Duran and has a grocery store.  She started her store when she was widowed.  She tells us that she didn’t want to appear defeated and her children gave her the strength to carry on day to day.  This is how this idea arose which was on point because her business has been growing and it’s very profitable.  She’s open every day of the week and works alone or with help from her daughter.

There is some crime in her area which is the most worrisome factor.  She has three adult, independent daughters but they tend to visit her.  
She will use the loan to buy rice, sugar, groceries, chicken and meat to increase her sales.  In the next few years she’d like to buy a vehicle that she can use for transportation when she has to go buy merchandise.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, groceries, meat and chicken.

loans.name: Gene Agustin

texts.es: Gene vive en Portoviejo, tiene 41 años de edad y se encuentra soltero. Es ebanista de profesión y tiene el taller en su domicilio. El negocio lo empezó por la falta de empleo y por recomendación de varias personas a quienes le gustaba su trabajo. En la actualidad el administra e incluso tiene empleados quienes laboran de 8 a 5 de la tarde de lunes a sábado. Con el crédito va a comprar madera e insumos para la fabricación de muebles. Le gustaría ampliar su negocio con esto mejorar su economía.
texts.en: Gene lives in Portoviejo.  He’s 41-years-old and single.  He’s a cabinetmaker by profession and has his shop at home.  He started the business due to the lack of employment and responding to the recommendation of several people who liked his work.  He currently runs it and even has employees who work from 8 to 5 in the afternoon, Monday through Saturday.  He will use the loan to buy lumber and supplies to make furniture.  He’d like to expand the business and improve his economy this way.

loans.use: to buy lumber.

loans.name: Leat's Group

texts.en:
Leat is 32 years old and married. She has two dependent children who are still in school. Cassava planting is her single main source of family’s income to make a living in a village of Dambae district of Cambodia. She has been in this business for several years. The main challenge for her family’s business is the drop in cassava’s price which affected her family’s income.

Leat is on her second loan with VisionFund while the other member of the group is just with VisionFund this loan cycle. Leat completely paid back the first loan, which has helped her afford to buy household necessities. With her current business, she can earn around 16,000 KHR per day. With a good business, she is leading her group to apply for a loan of 500,000 KHR each. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers for farmland and use a portion of it to spend for land preparation. She hopes this loan will make her business prosper and she also hopes to keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for farmland

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
Sok, aged 50, is a rural villager living in Dambae district, Cambodia. He has five children to take care of. The family’s primary source of income is from cassava planting. He has been in this business for almost twenty years to support his family. 

This is the second loan for Sok’s group consisting of three members. He completely repaid the first loan, which has helped him keep his children in school and make a living better. He is now able to make a daily income of around 26,000 KHR to spend for daily expenses. He is now leading his group to apply for a loan. As the leader, he is going to use his portion to buy fertilizers for his farmland. He hopes to improve his lifestyle and keep his children in school so they will have a good job.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his farmland

loans.name: Gabriela Apolonia

texts.es: Gabriela vive en Isla Trinitaria sector sur urbano de Guayaquil. Tiene 56 años y está casada. Estudio maestría y gracias a esos conocimientos decidió abrir el bazar. El negocio lo maneja con su esposo de lunes a sábados. Su mayor dificultad son las calles ya que no están asfaltadas lo que impide que lleguen sus proveedores. Gabriela nos comenta que su esposo es retirados y sus hijos son independientes pero si los visitan. El crédito lo utilizara en la compra de una copiadora y mercadería. Le gustaría que el municipio regenere su sector y con esto mejoraría su venta.
texts.en: Gabriela lives in Isla Trinitaria, an urban sector in south Guayaquil.  She’s 56 years old and married.  She studied for a Master’s degree and thanks to that learning decided to open a store.  She runs the business with her husband, Monday to Saturday.  Her greatest difficulty are the streets because they are unpaved which prevents her suppliers from reaching her.  Gabriela comments that her husband is retired and her children are independent but they do visit them.  She will use the loan to buy a copier and merchandise.  She’d like the city to renovate her sector which would improve her sales.

loans.use: to buy a copier and merchandise.

loans.name: Gs El Valle Group

texts.es:
La señora Norma, tiene 48 años de edad tiene 2 hijos,  y es madre soltera, Su actividad principal es la venta ropa de niño, ropa americana, zapatos de niño, suéteres, tiene  3 años de experiencia en el manejo de su negocio, Doña Norma,  esta solicitando el apoyo del préstamo para la compra ropa de niño, ropa de segunda mano, zapatos de niño, suéteres, camisas, pantalones y otros productos, para la buena atención de sus clientes, Doña Norma es una persona muy trabajadora, y su negocio esta ubicado en su casas de habitación, en algunas ocasiones ella vende de manera ambulante en las comunidades cercanas, eso le ayuda a tener mejores ventas,  con el apoyo solicitado del préstamo que reciba Doña Norma, le contribuirá a tener un mejor negocio, y así obtener mejores ingresos para cubrir los gastos en el hogar y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
Doña Norma sueña con tener, vitrinas y aparadores para vender a futuro cremas, lociones, joyería y tener el mejor negocio de la zona.
Sonia, se dedica al comercio su actividad principal es la venta de verduras al por mayor.
Pedro, se dedica al comercio y su actividad principal es la venta de maíz y cerdos, El  tiene  4 años de experiencia en el  manejo del mismo, tiene 4 hijos y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa.
En la fotografía aparece una amiga del grupo quien luego no pudo participar con sus compañeros de grupo por motivos personales. 
Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - Abril 2012
texts.en:
Norma is 48 years old and is a single mother with two children. Her main business activity is selling children's clothing, american clothing, children's shoes, and sweaters. She has three years of experience in managing her business. 
Norma is requesting the support of a loan in order to purchase children's clothing, used clothing, children's shoes, sweaters, shirts, pants, and other products, so that she can offer her customers good service. Norma is a very hard worker and her business is located in her home. Sometimes she sells on the street in nearby communities, which helps her increase sales. The support afforded by this loan will help Norma have a better business, so that she can earn a higher income to cover home expenses and give her family a better quality of life.
Norma's dream for the future is to have showcases and display cabinets to sell creams, lotions, and jewelry, and to have the best business in the area.

Sonia works mainly in the business of selling wholesale vegetables. 
Pedro works mainly in the business of selling corn and pigs. He has four years of experience managing his business. He has four children and counts on his wife's support. 
The picture shows a friend of the group who was later unable to participate with the other members of the group for personal reasons.

Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - April, 2012

loans.use: to purchase children's clothing, used clothing, children's shoes, sweaters, shirts, pants, and other products for her business.

loans.name: Las Pioneras Group

texts.es: La Sra. Deysi  es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar, Deysi  tiene 32 años de edad  actualmente es integrante en la alcancía comunal “Las Pioneras” grupo  conformado por  8 socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio. Deysi   trabaja desde hace 6  años en una bodega que está ubicada en su casa este negocio surge a raíz de que sus hijos empezaron  asistir al colegio, Deysi  sabía que necesitaba más ingresos para poder cubrir la educación de sus hijos y los gastos básicos de alimentación y pago de servicio   es así que tenía un capital y lo invirtió en comprar insumos arroz, leche, gaseosa etc.,  con el tiempo su negocio fue creciendo Deysi nos cuenta que todo lo logro trabajando muy duro con el apoyo de su esposo , gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado mejores ingresos económicos, sus hijos pudieron estudiar, poco apoco fue comprando cosas para su hogar y sobre todo su familia cuenta con una mejor calidad de vida,  con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar insumos (Arroz, Fideos) .Sabemos que Deysi  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
Sra. Deysi is in a common-law relationship and has two school-age children. She is 32 years old and currently a member of the Communal Bank "Las Pioneras" (The Pioneers), which consists of eight members who engage in different retail activities.

Deysi works in a store located in her home. She started this business six years ago when her children were starting school. Deysi knew that she needed more money to cover the cost of her children's education and to pay for basic expenses, such as food and utilities. She used whatever capital she had to invest in the purchase of staples such as rice, milk, sodas, and other products and her business grew over time. Deysi says that she has worked very hard with the support of her husband. Thanks to her effort and dedication, her income has improved, her children are able to study, and she has gradually been able to buy things for her home so that her entire family can have a better quality of life.

Deysi is requesting a new loan in order to buy staples, such as rice and noodles. With the help of the loans from EDAPROSPO, she will be able to accomplish her goals through hard work and effort.

loans.use: to buy rice and noodles.

loans.name: Lun's Group

texts.en:
Lun is 40 years old and a father of one boy and two girls, all of whom are students. He and his family live in Dambae district and have been farming rice and growing cassava for twenty years to support their family. One challenge of their business is when the price of cassava drops. Lun obtained the first loan from VisionFund in 2011 and he is now leading another group member to apply for another loan after his third loan and her first loan repaid.

 Lun is planning to use his portion for land preparation for his plantation and buy fertilizers for his crops. He hopes this loan can help to sufficiently support his family and his children's education fees.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and to use for land preparation

loans.name: Cruz Maria

texts.es: Cruz María tiene 57 años de edad. Viven en Isla Trinitaria sector periurbano de Guayaquil. Hace 20 años abrió su tienda de abarrotes. Empezó con una pequeña refrigeradora vendiendo colas. Poco a poco a medida que fue creciendo empezó a surtirla. El negocio lo maneja sola abriendo de lunes a sábados. Cruz Maria nos comenta que ahora tiene competencia pero como está bien ubicada sus ventas no bajan. En la actualidad vive sola ya que no está casada y sus hijos son mayores de edad. Con el préstamo comprara víveres, arroz, azúcar, snacks. Su meta futura es construir el segundo piso de su casa para poder alquilar y así aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Cruz María, 57, lives in Isla Trinitaria, a periurban sector in Guayaquil.  She opened her grocery store 20 years ago.  She started with a small refrigerator selling colas.  Little by little as it grew she started to stock it.  She runs the business alone opening Monday to Saturday.

Cruz María tells us that now she has competition but because she’s well located her sales have not dropped.  She currently lives alone since she’s not married and her children are all adults.

She will use the loan to buy groceries, rice, sugar and snacks.   Her future goal is to build a second story on her house to be able to rent and increase her income that way.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Yeng's Group

texts.en:
Yeng, aged 55, is a mother of six children who lives in a rural village of Dambae district of Cambodia. Four of them (two daughters and two sons) are dependent on her and still in school. She is a peasant who has been farming cassava on 1.5 hectares of farmland as a primary source of income for eight years and she supplements her income by raising pig on the side. The main challenge for her family’s business is the death of pigs and the drop of the price of cassava. 

This is the second loan for Yeng’s group of two members who live in the same village. The first loan helped her increase her pigs. With her current business, she is able to earn 23,000 KHR per day. With a good business, she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy more piglets and use a portion of it to spend for her cassava plantation. This loan will enable her to expand her family’s business and she hopes to make a living better and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and to spend for her cassava plantation

loans.name: Clerida Yaneth

texts.es:
Doña Clerida de 44 años de edad casada con dos hijos ella vive junto a su familia en una aldea ubicada al sur de honduras ella es una mujer muy ejemplar se a dedicado a su negocio  de pulpería ya hace varios años en donde vente una variedad de abarrotería como ser: pollo, papas, refrescos, jabon, manteca, crema y también se dedica a la venta de repuestos para bicicleta.
Doña Clerida esta solicitando un préstamo de 20,000 lempiras para la compra de pollo, papas, refrescos, jabón, manteca, crema, achinería, neumáticos para bicicleta, parches, salineras, ejes, pedales y otros repuestos para bicicleta. Con el apoyo de este crédito ella podrá trabajar más en su negocio porque su inventario será más grande y las ventas indudablemente mejoraran porque habrá más producto que ofrecer a los clientes.
El sueño de Doña Clerida es  tener mayor clientela para poder vender más y así seguir educando a sus hijos y mejorar su casa.
San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Abril 2012
texts.en:
Clerida is 44 years old and married with two children. She lives with her family in a village located in southern Honduras. She is an exemplary woman who has been working in her small business for several years. Her small convenience store sells a variety of groceries, such as chicken, potatoes, soft drinks, soap, lard, and cream, and also sells spare parts for bicycles. 
Clerida is requesting a 20,000 lempira loan in order to purchase chicken, potatoes, soft drinks, soap, lard, cream, low cost goods, bycicle tires, patches, axles, pedals, and other bicycle spare parts. The support afforded by this loan will allow her to work harder on her business because she will have more inventory and undoubtedly sales will increase because she will have many more products to offer her customers.
Clerida's dream is to have a broader customer base so that she can make more sales in order to keep up with her children's education and home improvements.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  April, 2012

loans.use: to purchase chicken, potatoes, soft drinks, soap, lard, cream, low cost goods, bycicle tires, patches, axles, pedals, and other bicycle spare parts for her business.

loans.name: Lina Maria

texts.es:
Lina es una persona que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajadora, y gracias a esta cualidad ha logrado superar grandes dificultades que se le han presentado en la vida. Hasta hace aproximadamente 3 años trabajaba en una empresa vendiendo ropa, pero dado que su salario no era suficiente para poder contribuir económicamente en su hogar, decidió independizarse y montar su propio negocio. Fue así como desde hace unos 3 años montó un cibercafé donde ofrece a sus clientes el servicio de Internet y gracias a la buena atención ha logrado captar muy buenos clientes. La principal ventaja que tiene es que está ubicada en un sector estratégico, pues cerca de su negocio hay tres colegios lo que le permite tener muy buena afluencia de clientes, sin embargo, su mayor dificultad es que existe mucha competencia que compite con muy buenos precios, por lo que ahora busca que un préstamo le permita comprar productos de papelería para ofrecer a sus clientes el servicio de impresión y argollado de las mismas, y así poder generar diferenciación en sus clientes.

De esta manera su negocio podrá diferenciarse de la competencia permitiendo así poder salir adelante y continuar con su negocio, además, espera que de esta manera sus ingresos aumenten considerablemente, permitiendo tener una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en:
Lina is a person who has always been know for her hardworking personality, and thanks to this quality she has had success in surmounting the difficulties that life has presented to her.  For about the past three years, she had been working in a store selling clothing, but because her salary was not enough to contribute greatly to the expenses of her household, she decided to go independent and create her own business.

Thus, about three years ago, she opened an internet cafe where she provides her customers with internet service, and thanks to the good service, she has been able to gain many good customers.  The first advantage of the business in that it's in a strategic location, since there are three private schools nearby, allowing her to bring in well-off customers.  Without a doubt, her greatest difficulty is in that there's a great deal of competition at very low prices, so she is asking for this loan in order to buy stationery products to offer her customers printing services and copies, and to be able to diversify her clientele.

In this way, her business will be able to set itself apart from the competition, permitting her to move forward and continue with her business.  In addition, she hopes that this will greatly increase her income, allowing her to have a better quality of life and greater opportunities for economic advancement.

loans.use: to buy stationery to offer her customers printing services and creation of copies, and thus to diversify her clientele.

loans.name: Eva Del Carmen

texts.es: Eva tiene 50 años. Vive en Las Orquídeas sector norte de Guayaquil. Abrió la papelería cuando su esposo se jubilo de las fuerzas armadas. Con este capital aumento el negocio y las ventas. El trabajo no lo realiza sola ya que tiene la ayuda de su esposo. No tiene horario fijo pero si abre de lunes a sábados. No presenta ninguna dificultad en el mismo y espera continuar así. Tiene 3 hijos pero son mayores e independientes. Con el crédito comprara cuadernos, plumas, lápiz, borrador. Su meta futura es adecuar el local para el crecimiento del negocio.
texts.en: Eva, 50, lives in Las Orquídeas, a sector in north Guayaquil.  She opened her stationery shop when her husband retired from the armed forces.  With this capital she enlarged the business and sales.  She does not work alone since she gets help from her husband.  She does not have a fixed schedule but she does open Monday to Saturday.  She does not have any difficulties at present and hopes to continue that way.  She has three children but they are all independent adults.  She will use the loan to buy notebooks, pencils, pens and erasers.  Her future goal is to equip her locale for business growth.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pens, pencils and erasers.

loans.name: Luz Mireya

texts.es:
Luz es una persona muy trabajadora que ha tenido que luchar fuertemente para sacar su hijo de 15 años adelante, pues el padre de su hijo los abandonó hace un tiempo sin hacer alguna contribución para su sostenimiento. Desde hace aproximadamente 15 años viene desempeñándose en la actividad de la peluquería trabajando en diferentes salas de belleza, y desde hace unos 4 años decidió montar su propio salón de belleza. Gracias a su buena experiencia tiene muy buenos clientes y esto le garantiza muy buenas ventas, las cuales cada vez vienen creciendo lo que le permite ampliar su negocio. Luz busca un préstamo para poder comprar insumos para su salón de belleza como tintes, shampoo, tratamientos, entre otros, y así seguir atendiendo bien a sus clientes.

De esta manera su negocio seguirá creciendo permitiéndole tener buenos ingresos y así su hijo y ella podrán tener una buena calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas que les permita progresar.
texts.en:
Luz is a very hard-working person who has had to fight hard to get her 15 year old son ahead.  Her son’s father abandoned him some time ago.  His father did so without making any contribution to his son's support.

She has been working as a hairdresser in different beauty salons for approximately 15 years.  Four years ago she decided to establish her own beauty salon.  Thanks to her good experience, she has very good customers.  This guarantees good sales, which are growing every day, and it allows her to expand her business.

Luz is looking for a loan in order to be able to buy supplies for her beauty salon.  She will buy things like dyes, shampoo, and treatments, among other things.  This way she will continue giving her customers good service.

In this manner her business will continue growing, allowing her to have good income.  She and her son will be able to have a good quality of life and greater financial opportunities, which will allow them to advance.

loans.use: to buy things like dyes, shampoo, and treatments, among other things in order to continue giving her customers good service.

loans.name: Luz Aracelly

texts.es:
Luz tiene un cultivo de caléndula que es una planta medicinal, y gracias a este trabajo genera ingresos con los cuales contribuye al sostenimiento de todos los gastos que se generan en su hogar, ya que el salario que recibe su esposo no es suficiente para poder sostener los gastos de su hogar. Sus plantas las vende en una tienda naturista de la ciudad y así recibe ingresos por su trabajo, y gracias a que su cliente le hace muy buenos pedidos ha logrado crecer con su negocio. Sin embargo, el invierno le ha venido presentando algunas dificultades, por lo que busca que un préstamo le permita comprar abonos, insecticidas y fungicidas para sacar su cultivo adelante pese al invierno que se está presentando.

Así, su cultivo podrá seguir siendo de muy buena calidad y seguirá recibiendo muy buenos ingresos por este, permitiendo así brindar a su esposo y sus hijos una buena calidad de vida en el hogar. Su sueño es incrementar su cultivo logrando vender una mayor cantidad y generar empleo para los más necesitados.
texts.en:
Luz grows marigolds which is a medicinal plant and thanks to this work generates income to contribute towards household expenses because her husband’s salary is insufficient to cover all household expenses.  She sells her plants to a natural products store in the city and gets income for her work that way and thanks to her customer placing very good orders with her she’s managed to grow with her business.  

However, winter has brought some difficulties so she’s looking for a loan so that she will be able to buy manure, insecticide and fungicide to move her crops forward despite the winter that’s being experienced.  Her crops will be of good quality this way and she will continue receiving very good income for it allowing her to provide her husband and children with a good quality of life in their home.  Her dream is to increase her crops to sell larger amounts and generate employment for those most in need.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Joe Fernando

texts.es: Joe tiene 32 años viven en Duran. Padre de familia  y de profesión soldador. Empezó comprando sus herramientas para uso personal. Luego de esto su familia le sugirió que realice trabajos a domicilio a particulares. De esta manera hoy tiene su negocio propio con una cartera de clientes. El trabajo lo realiza todos los días, en su taller o movilizándose donde lo requieran. Su mayor inconveniente se presenta al dirigirse a los domicilios de las personas que solicitan su servicio ser víctima de robo. Esto se debe a que lleva herramientas de alto costo. Joe es casado, su esposa no labora ya que se dedica al cuidado del hogar. Tiene 4 hijos de 13, 8, 6 y 2 años de edad que asisten a la escuela fiscal. Con el préstamo va a comprar una máquina soldadora y taladro. Le gustaría en próximos años equipar su taller con maquinas actualizadas y así mejorar su economía.
texts.en:
Joe is 32 years old and lives in Duran. He is a father and a welder by profession. Joe began purchasing tools for personal use, but later on his family suggested that he solicit jobs from private residences. This led to the business he owns today, along with a list of existing customers. Joe works every day at his shop, but he travels to different sites as needed. The major challenge he faces is dealing with the risk of getting robbed whenever he visits the homes of people who request his services. It should be noted that his tools are quite expensive.

Joe is married. His wife does not have an outside job, so she is devoted to being a full-time homemaker. They have four children (ages 13, 8, 6, and 2), most of whom attend a state school. Joe will use his loan to buy a welding machine and a drill. Within the next few years, he would like to equip his workshop with upgraded machines so that he can improve his financial standing.

loans.use: to purchase a welding machine and a drill.

loans.name: Azamjon

texts.ru: Азамчон работает электриком на  алюминиевом заводе с 2008 года. На воспитании имеет двух сыновей. Жена занимается домохозяйством и присматривает за детьми. Азамчон мечтал всегда иметь красивый дом и создать уют и комфорт для своего дома. С этой целью Азамчон запрашивает займ для покупки цемента, камней и песка для ремонта своего дома. Он и его семья надеются на вашу помощь.
texts.en: Azamjon has been working as an electrician at an aluminum manufacturing factory since 2008. His is bringing up two sons.  His wife is a homemaker and takes care of the children.  Azamjon has always dreamed of having a beautiful house and creating coziness and comfort in his house. With this goal, Azamjon is requesting a loan to purchase cement, stones and sand for the repair of his house. He and his family are hoping for your help.

loans.use: To purchase of cement, sand and stones for the repair of his house.

loans.name: Lusmila America

texts.es: Lusmila tiene 37 años, vive en Fortín zona sur de Guayaquil. Tiene un bazar en su domicilio. Su idea se debió a que vive frente a la escuela del sector. Como hay mucha concurrencia de niños y adultos tomo la decisión. El negocio lo abre de lunes a domingos sin horario determinado. Le gusta ya que gracias a esto puede dedicarles tiempo a sus hijos. Lusmila está casada con Rubén quien es cargador en el mercado. Tienen 4 hijos quienes están en la escuela. Con el crédito comprara cuadernos, lápiz, borrador, papel del regalo, peluches. Su meta a futuro es ampliar su negocio para mejorar su economía.
texts.en: Lusmila, 37, lives in the Fortin neighborhood south of Guayaquil.  She has a store in her house.  She got this idea because she lives in front of the neighborhood school, an area that is very busy with children and adults.  Her business is open every day, without a set schedule.  She likes it because thanks to the business, she can spend more time with her children.  Lusmila is married to Ruben, who works as a porter in the market.  They have 4 children who are in school.  With this loan, she will buy notebooks, pencils, erasers, gift paper and stuffed animals.  Her goal for the future is to expand her business to improve her finances.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pencils, erasers, gift paper and stuffed animals

loans.name: Nancy Del Rocio

texts.es: Nancy tiene 34 años, está casada con José. Su negocio lo inicio por iniciativa de su esposo. Nancy nos cuenta que él trabajaba haciendo panes ganando 3 dólares diarios. Por esto y con la ayuda de sus familiares reunieron el capital necesario para abrir su panadería. Atienden desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche. Actualmente tiene una tienda para mejorar sus ingresos. Su esposo es quien se dedica a la elaboración de los panes. Tienen 4 hijos de 15, 13, 8 y 5 años de edad todos en etapa estudiantil. Con el crédito va a comprar harina, confitería. Su sueño es que su tienda prospere hasta ser una panificadora.
texts.en: Nancy, 34, is married to José.  She started the business due to her husband’s initiative.  Nancy tells us that he worked baking bread and earning three dollars per day.  Because of this and with help from their relatives they gathered the necessary capital to open their own bakery.  They are open from 5 in the morning to 10 at night.  She currently has a store to improve her income.  Her husband is the one that makes the bread.  They have four children who are 15, 13, 8 and 5 years of age and all are in the schooling phase.  She will use the loan to buy flour and sweets.  Her dream is that her store progresses until it becomes an industrial bakery.

loans.use: to buy flour and sweets.

loans.name: Rosibel

texts.es:
Doña Rosibel es una persona muy emprendedora dedicada al 100% a su negocio, que  es venta  de  comida o comedor.  Vive con sus 3 hijos. En  Choluteca en el sur de Honduras. Y tiene más de 18 años  de  tener este tipo  de negocio.
Doña Rosibel el préstamo lo invertirá en  la  compra de carnes res, cerdo, pollo  y condimentos y de esta manera incrementar más sus ventas. Con el préstamo  espera incrementar sus ventas y así atender mejor a sus clientes, y agenciarse  de  mejores  utilidades.
Doña Rosibel sus  sueños  es  poder    darles  a sus  hijos  una   educación   y así poder  darle  una  mejor  forma  de  vida.
Choluteca  Honduras - Abril del 2012
texts.en:
Rosibel is a very enterprising woman who is 100% dedicated to her business, which is selling food or meals. She lives with her three children in Choluteca, in southern Honduras. She has been in this business for over 18 years.
Rosibel will invest her loan in the purchase of meat (beef, pork, chicken) and herbs and spices, so that she can further increase sales. She hopes to achieve this with this loan so that she can offer her customers better service and obtain higher earnings. 
Rosibel's dream is to be able to give her children an education so that they can have a better lifestyle.  

Choluteca  Honduras - April, 2012

loans.use: to purchase meat (beef, pork, chicken) and herbs and spices for her business.

loans.name: Marzo Group

texts.es: Dulce tiene 28 años de edad, es miembro del Grupo Solidario Marzo, es madre soltera de 3 hijos, ella y sus hijos residen en la Colonia Buenos Aires, de la Ciudad de Juticalpa, Olancho. Ella se dedica desde hace 15 años a la venta de golosinas y refrescos, comenzó muy pequeña pues sus padres murieron y quedaron huérfanos, Dulce era la hermana mayor y le toco mantener a sus hermanos menores por lo que decidió  comenzar a vender jugos y bolsas con agua en las diferentes rutas de buses, ella inicia su horario laboral desde las 7:00 am hasta las 6:00 pm, sus dos hijos le colaboran en el negocio. Las desventajas que a Dulce se le presentan es que las ventas las realiza de forma ambulante y tiene que lidiar con los cambios de clima y tiene que andar maltratando a sus hijos. Uno de sus sueños es poder tener un local propio para ya no tener que andar vendiendo ambulantemente. El préstamo que Dulce solicita lo necesita para invertirlo en la compra de refrescos, dulces, alborotos, pan, agua, entre otros. Con la ayuda de este préstamo podrá surtir bien su negocio, podrá vender más y de esta forma obtener mayores ganancias que le ayuden a los gastos educativos, de alimentación y de salud de sus hijos. Dulce tiene mas de tres años de solicitar prestamos en FAMA y ha sido una cliente muy puntual con sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Dulce, age 28, is a member of the “Marzo” (March) communal bank.  She is the single mother of three children.  She and her children live in the Buenos Aires neighborhood of the city of Juticalpa, Olancho.

She has been selling snacks and soft drinks for 15 years.  She started when she was very young.  Her parents died, and the children were orphaned.  Dulce was the oldest sister, and it fell to her to support her younger siblings.  She decided to start selling juices and bags of water on the different bus routes.  She starts her work day at 7:00 a.m., and she works until 6:00 p.m.  Her two children help in the business.

The challenges that Dulce faces are that she sells in an itinerant manner and she has to deal with the changes of climate, and she has to walk, which takes its toll on her children.

One of her dreams is to be able to have her own place so that she does not have sell on foot.

Dulce needs the requested loan to buy soft drinks, candy, groceries, bread, and water, among other things.  With the help of the loan she will be able to stock her business well, sell more, and get greater income.  The income will help her with the educational, food, and health expenses of her children.

Dulce has been requesting loans from FAMA for over three years.  She has been very punctual with her payments.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, candy, groceries, bread, and water, among other things.

loans.name: Cintia Yanet

texts.es:
Cintia tiene 38 de años de edad, es soltera y vive en Playas. Tiene una despensa  que funciona en la casa de sus padres.
En un principio el negocio pertenecía a su mamá quien lo inicio de muy joven, cuando empezó a envejecer tomo la decisión de continuar ella. Atiende a su clientela de lunes a domingo de 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. Se dedica a tiempo completo porque no estudia y porque es el sustento de su familia. Al momento no tiene ningún inconveniente en su negocio ya que el barrio es tranquilo. No tiene hijos pero Cintia nos cuenta que hace cinco años su hermana falleció y dejo dos niños pequeños quienes son su razón de superación. Ellos se han convertido en la fuerza que necesita para luchar día a día y darles  todo lo que su mamá le hubiera dado. El préstamo lo empleara en la compra de víveres y útiles escolares para ampliar sus ventas. Su sueño es ver crecer a sus sobrinos sanos, brindarles ayuda en sus estudios aumentado su negocio.
texts.en: Cintia is 38 years old, single and lives in Playas, Ecuador. She has a convenience store that she runs out of her parents' house. At first the business belonged to her mother, who started it when she was very young, and when Cintia got older she made the decision to continue the business. She tends to customers Monday through Sunday from 6 a.m. until 9 p.m. She dedicates herself completely because she did not go to school and it is her family's sustenance. At the moment she has no problems with the business since it is in a quiet neighborhood. She doesn't have children, but Cintia tells us that five years ago her sister died and she was left with two small children who are her motivation to move up in life. The children have turned into the force she needs to fight from day to day to give them what their mother would have given them. She plans to use the loan to purchase groceries and school supplies to expand her sales. Her dream is for her nephews to grow up healthy and for her business to help provide for their education.

loans.use: to purchase groceries and school supplies.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio es un hombre de 37 años de edad, de estado civil casado, con 03 hijos a su cargo, vive en casa propia de material rústico en el Caserío Dos Palos, distrito de Mórrope, departamento de Lambayeque. No cuentan con el servico básico de energía eléctrica, el consumo de agua lo hacen a través de norias artesanales; bajo estas condiciones viven la mayoría de gente. 
	

La actividad principal que realiza Julio es la venta de pescado fresco como: caballa, suco, cachema; Julio recorre en mototaxi por los caseríos aledaños de la zona, donde tiene sus clientes ya establecidos. Cliente tiene 10 años de experiencia en el mencionado rubro. Adicionalmente cliente se dedica a la agricultura, donde tiene sembrado 1 Ha de fríjol chileno en terreno propio, donde le permite tener otros ingresos. Su cónyuge se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral como: Patos, pavos, gallinas, donde tambièn le apoya en la canasta familiar.

El monto del Crédito solicitado es de S/. 2500 nuevos soles y será destinado a invertirlo en la compra de pescado como: caballa, cachema, suco; siendo este un negocio muy rentable en la zona, y le va permitir mejorar su nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Julio is a 37-year-old man who is married and has three children in his care.  He lives in his own house made from flimsy materials in the Dos Palos settlement in Mórrope District, Lambayeque Department.  They do not have basic electricity service and water consumption is done through artesian wells.  Most of the people live under these conditions.

The main activity Julio does is selling fresh fish like: mackerel, croaker and corvina.  Julio visits settlements adjacent to his zone with his mototaxi where he has established customers.  He has ten years’ experience in the aforementioned line of work.  In addition, he also works in agriculture; he has one hectare of his own land planted with Chilean beans which is an additional source of income for him.  His spouse raises barnyard fowl like ducks, turkeys and chickens which also helps with the family’s basic staple needs.
