Her life as a trader began when she separated from husband - she had no income and decided to start selling beauty products by catalog so that she could care for their children. After that, she decided to add some variety to her products and started to sell CDs and notebooks. She trades from the living room in her home. 

Eugenia says that she likes finding ways to make money, and so she also sells lunch. In the interview, Eugenia told us that as  the head of the family and is always looking for ways to be productive and make money. She has 3 children who study at the public school, and they also help her with the business in their free time. 

This loan will be used to purchase products such as creams, perfumes, makeup, and clothes to sell. Eugenia hopes to improve her business and pay her installments without any problems.

loans.use: to purchase creams, perfumes, makeup, and clothes.

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en: Gagik lives in Meghri with his wife and little son. Gagik works at the local canned food factory, but his salary is too low to cover the family's costs. So Gagik is also involved in agriculture. He raises cattle, and now his farm consists of 2 cows and 4 pigs. Gagik also keeps 5 beehives. He has applied for this loan to develop cattle breeding. With the requested amount he plans to purchase 3 cows. This will allow Gagik to increase the income from agriculture and ensure a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to pay for 3 cows

loans.name: Styopa

texts.en:
Styopa lives in Vostan village with his father, younger brother and grandmother. Styopa is involved in agriculture together with his family members. He is very enthusiastic and full of desire to develop the family farm, for which he needs necessary funds. He has applied for this loan to purchase 2 pigs. Styopa will also purchase tomato seeds, fertilizer and medicine. 

Styopa dreams of funding a big farm, where he will have conditions to grow different types of fruits and vegetables. Current development of the farm will provide a good base for Styopa  to reach his goal.

loans.use: to pay for 2 pigs, tomato seeds, fertilizer and medicine

loans.name: Hortense Afiavi

texts.fr: Hortense Afiavi est mariée et mère d'1 enfant scolarisé âgé de 09 ans. Elle a encore un enfant à charge. Hortense Afiavi est coiffeuse de formation et y associe la vente des mèches,des tissages ainsi que des produits depuis 14 ans. Hortense Afiavi s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés de l'extérieur et ses clients sont essentiellement des femmes et ses collègues coiffeuses. Elle veut s'acheter des mèches, des tissages et des produits. Hortense Afiavi avec ses économies veut contribuer activement à la charge familiale.
texts.en:
Hortense Afiavi is married and the mother of a 9 year old child, who attends school. She has one other child living in the household. Hortense Afiavi is a hairdresser by training, and has also sold hair extensions, weaves and hair products for the last 14 years.
Hortense Afiavi buys her stock in one of the outlying markets, and her customers are mostly women and other hairdressers.
She wants to purchase extensions, weaves and hair products. With her savings, Hortense Afiavi wants to actively contribute to the household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase 30 hair extensions, 30 weaves and other various products.

loans.name: Joemar

texts.en:
This is Joemar, 42, a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. He is single and works hard to sustain himself and continually provide income for his everyday expenses.

Joemar operates a food stall where he sells fish balls. In the Philippines, fish balls are commonly sold at street stalls; they are served skewered and can be dipped in different kinds of sauces. Fish balls are somewhat flat in shape and often made with the meat of a cuttlefish. His other products include squid balls and quail eggs. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 200 Philippines pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue his business operations, he is requesting an 11,000 PHP loan. He will use the loan to buy more fish ball products and other ingredients needed in his business. He expects a boost to his income as he expands his business.

Joemar hopes to be able to expand his business soon. He faithfully meets up with his fellowship* co-members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of fish ball products needed for his business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 46 years old and married with one child.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and other groceries to sell in her store.

Josephine has borrowed and paid for six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for three years.  Josephine aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Lidia Maria

texts.es: Lidia nació en Pueblo Viejo pero actualmente vive en Quevedo. Tiene 62 años y se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos. Nos cuenta que en Pueblo Viejo vivía en una finca donde se criaban animales y desde muy pequeña le enseñaron para que ayudara. Al casarse su esposo la llevo a vivir a la cuidad de Quevedo donde era ama de casa dedicándose al cuidado de sus hijos. Hace 8 años empezó el oficio porque se separo de su esposo y necesitaba solventar sus gastos. Le gusta su trabajo porque le da tiempo a cuidar de su salud y descansar. La alimentación y limpieza de los animales la realiza con su nuera quien le ayuda en los momentos que no se encuentran. Su mayor preocupación es que sus animales se le enfermen ya perdería capital, ganancia y el esfuerzo de criarlos. Sus hijos son todos mayores de edad tienen su propia familia, la visitan de vez en cuando. Con el crédito comprar maíz, vitaminas para el engorde de los pollos y algunos materiales para arreglar su casa ya que le gustaría terminar su construcción.
texts.en:
Linda was born in Pueblo Viejo but now lives in Quevedo.  She is 62 years old and she raises and sells chicken.  She tells us that in Pueblo Viejo she lived on a farm where they raised animals, and when she was a child she was taught how work with them.

When she married her husband she came to Quevedo and spent her time raising their children and taking care of the household.  8 years ago she began working because she separated from her husband and she needed to pay her expenses.

She likes her work because it gives her time to care for her health and to rest.  She feeds and cleans the animals with her daughter, who always helps her when she needs help.  Her biggest worry is that her animals will get sick and she will lose her income, money, and the ability to care for them.  Her children are all adults and have their own families and she visits them from time to time.

With this loan she will buy corn, vitamins to fatten the chicken, and other supplies so that she can fix up her house (she would like to finish construction on her house).

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her chicken.

loans.name: Calixta Cirila

texts.es: Calixta vive en quevedo inicio su tienda de venta de abarrotes hace 12 años. en un principio vendía solo gaseosas, partiendo de ahí tuvo gran acogida. Entre risas nos cuenta que nunca pensé que la gente tomara tanta cola. Con el tiempo su negocio fue ganando acogida con lo cual los clientes empezaron a preguntar por otros productos. Hoy en día tiene una tienda mas surtida con lo cual trabaja de lunes a domingos desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de lo noche. La atención está a su cargo pero recibe ayuda de sus familiares cuando se encuentran de visita, a pesar de tener 61 años se mantiene activa y le gusta. Le preguntamos si tenía algún tipo de inconvenientes en su trabajo y nos informa que no, pero en lo referente a  su salud a estado algo enferma. Calixta es divorciada, tiene 4 hijos todos mayores e independientes. Con el crédito comprara productos para su tienda como gaseosas, confetis, mesa, sillas. Su meta a futuro es remodelar su casa para mejorar su local y aumentarlo.
texts.en:
Calixta lives in Quevedo where she has had a grocery store for 12 years.  At first she only sold soft drinks and it went well.  While smiling, she tells us that she never thought that people could drink so much cola!  In time, her business grew and her customers began asking for other products.  Today she has a well-stocked store and she works from Monday to Sunday, from 6:00 AM to 9:00 PM.

Her focus is to manage her store, but she does get help from her relatives when she needs it.  Although she is 61 years old, she is still active and enjoys working.  We ask her if there are some inconveniences in her work and she tells us that there are not, except that at the moment she is a bit sick.

Calixta is divorced and she has four adult children that are independent.  With this loan she will buy products for her store such as soft drinks, confetti, tables, and chairs.  Her goal is to remodel her home which will help improve her neighborhood and local community.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, party decorations, tables, and chairs.

loans.name: Alba Del Rocio

texts.es: Alba vive en la Orquídeas sector norte de Guayaquil. Tiene 41 años y vive en una casa de su propiedad con su familia. Se dedica la venta de comida. Esta actividad la escogió por su hermana quien la animo solicitando su ayuda en las mañanas y ella en la tarde. Luego de esto su hermana salió embarazada por lo que no podía continuar en la venta así que decidió cederle el negocio y sus clientes. Actualmente lo maneja sola en un horario de 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. El esposo de Alba, Henry se dedica a la venta de mariscos recorriendo diversos puntos del sector. Tienen 3 hijos de 17, 10 y 7 años de edad quienes estudian en la escuela fiscal. Con el crédito comprara víveres, sillas, mesas para mejorar el local con lo que espera sus ventas aumenten. Su sueño es tener un local propio y de esta manera seguir trabajando para darles una mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Alba lives in the Orquídeas area in the north of Guayaquil. She is 41 years old and lives with her family in a house that she owns.  She sells food.  This work was introduced to her by her sister who always asked for her help in the mornings and the afternoons.  Eventually, her sister became pregnant and could not continue working, so Alba took over the business and the customers.  
	
Now Alba works alone from 8:00 AM until 6:00 PM daily.  Her husband Henry sells seafood in different parts of the region.  They have three children that are 17, 10, and 7 years old and they are all in public school.

With this loan, Alba will buy food, chairs, and tables to improve the eatery with the hopes to increase her sales.  Her dream is to have her own eatery and to continue working to provide a better education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase food, chairs, and tables.

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel is 26. He lives in Kapan with his father. About 9 months ago Samvel decided to start his own business of trading with fruits and vegetables. After creating a good foundation for the business, Samvel wants to expand it. 

This loan will help him to purchase fruits and vegetables. Samvel will increase sales and earn more income. Samvel dreams of starting his own family. To do this he needs to renovate his house and create better conditions. Development of the business will allow this young entrepreneur to make his dream come true.

loans.use: to pay for fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Nazik

texts.en:
Nazik lives with her mother and son. Nazik's son works at the copper factory. Nazik is involved in agriculture, while managing the household with her mother. Nazik keeps 10 beehives. Her son helps with beekeeping. 

Nazik would like to increase the number of beehives by purchasing 15 more. She also wants to purchase 20 hives for the bees. This will essentially increase her income which Nazik plans to invest in further development of beekpeeing.

loans.use: to pay for 15 beehives.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna lives in Nor Dvin village with her husband and son. For many years the family has run a farm where they grow vegetables in the green house and raise cattle. Susanna has applied for this loan to improve the condition of the green house and increase the number of cattle. 

With the requested loan Susanna plans to purchase 2 calves, forage, stakes for grape trees, medicine and fertilizer. This will allow Susanna to gather a good harvest of grapes. Susanna  will also develop cattle breeding which means additional income and improved living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to pay for 2 calves, stakes for grape trees, and medicine and fertilizer.

location.town: Nor Dvin village of Ararat region

loans.name: Mher

texts.en: Mher is involved in agriculture. He grows potatoes and beans, and raises cattle. Mher's family members, parents, brother and sister are also involved in agriculture. Mher's farm has all the necessary conditions for increasing production, which is why he has applied for this loan. With the loan, Mher will purchase calves, alfalfa seeds, fertilizer, and fuel. These purchases will give Mher the opportunity to grow more and to increase the amount of livestock he has, which will provide additional income for him.

loans.use: to pay for calves, alfalfa seeds, fertilizer, and fuel.

loans.name: Martha Isabel

texts.es: Martha vive en Isla Trinitaria sector sur urbano de Guayaquil. Es la Coop Jacobo Bucarán donde tiene su casa propia hace 16 años donde abrió su negocio. En sus inicios solo vendía agua por galones y gas, tuvo gran acogida ya que en su barrio no había este tipo de productos, gracias a esto su tienda se desarrollo con gran rapidez por lo que reuniendo el capital necesario abrió un cyber. La atención al público la realiza con su hija quien estudia computación. El horario es de lunes a domingo desde la mañana hasta la noche para tener clientela. Martha nos comenta que su sector es tranquilo por ese motivo no ha tenido mayores problemas con respecto a la delincuencia. Está casada con Hermenegildo quien es mecánico automotriz. Tienen 2 hijos quienes estudian en la escuela y universidad pública. Con el crédito va a comprar víveres para ampliar su negocio también artículos de computación para el cyber. Espera aumentar sus ventas para poder arreglar un poco su casa construyendo el segundo piso para ampliar el local comercial.
texts.en: Martha lives in the urban sector of Isla Trinitaria, in the south of Guayaquil, more precisely in the Coop Jacobo Bucarán, where she has had her own home for 16 years. Her business is located at her house; at the beginning, it consisted only in selling gallons of water and gas. She was very welcome in her neighbourhood because no one else sold these. Thanks to this, her business grew very swiflty, enabling her to gather the necessary capital to open an internet café. She attends customers together with her daughter, who studies computer science. The café stays open Monday to Sunday, from morning until night, in order to have customers. Martha tells us that her neighbourhood is quiet and thus she has not had serious trouble with criminal activity. She is married to Hermenegildo, who is an automobile mechanic. They have two children, who go to school and to state-run university. With the loan, Martha will buy provisions to expand her business as well as computer supplies for the internet café. She hopes to increase her sales in order to be able to build a second story to her house so as to have more space for her business.

loans.use: to buy provisions and computer supplies.

loans.name: Shalom:dios Con Nosotros Group

texts.es: La Sra. Olga  tiene  51  años de edad,  es separada  y tiene 2 hijos, Olga  actualmente es socia en la alcancía comunal “Shalom:Dios con Nosotros” grupo  conformado por 9 socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio.  Olga   se dedica a la venta de comida en un puesto en el mercado desde hace 7 años  , Olga nos cuenta  trabajo muy duro para lograr sus metas con el tiempo cuenta con clientes fidelizados y su negocio sigue creciendo, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación   sus hijos tienen educación y cuentan con una mejor calidad de vida. Olga ha solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar insumos (fideos, leche etc) y mejorar su puesto en el mercado.  Olga  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran
texts.en: Olga is 51 years old, she is separated and has two children. She currently belongs to the comunal bank "Shalom: Dios con Nosotros" ("Shalom: God With Us"), a group comprised of 9 members who are involved in various retail activities. Olga has been selling food from a stall at the market for 7 years. She tells us that she works very hard to achieve her goals. Over time, she has been gaining returning customers and her business continues to grow. Thanks to her efforts and dedication her children can go to school and have a better quality of life. Olga asks for a new loan to buy supplies (pasta, milk, etc.) and to improve her stall at the market. Olga will achieve her goals thanks to her efforts, her hard work, and the help provided by field partner Edaprospo's loans.

loans.use: to buy supplies and to improve her market stall.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is raising hogs to sell as her business. She has been doing it for over 10 years and earns about P3,000 whenever she sells a raised hog. 

Angelina is now 53 years old, married, and still strives hard to meet her family's needs. She has three children but lives separately from them.  She is now asking for additional capital to help sustain her hogs. She needs P11,000 to buy feed, vitamins, and medicine to use for her hog's sustenance.

Someday, Angelina hopes to make the business more profitable and keep ensuring the good nutrition of her hogs.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and medicine to use for her hog's sustenance.

loans.name: Annalisa

texts.en:
This is Annalisa, age 36, and a resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Samuel, a driver, and is the mother of one child. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. Annalisa is working hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Annalisa operates a variety store, which is a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages to the neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five pesos-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Annalisa earns money by buying wholesale and selling by the piece. Her store is next to her house. Her customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 pesos in sales daily.

To help her continue operating, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products for resale. She expects a boost in income as she expands the business. 

Annalisa hopes her business will grow in the coming years, and she dreams of giving her family a good future through her hard work. She faithfully meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups of 15 to 30 that meet weekly. The groups study the word of God, build social capital, and encourage the repayment of micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: La Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
Ana es enfermera particular y trabaja en un asilo. Ella tiene 04 hijos y por ellos trabaja mucho para poder mantenerlos y darles buena educación ya que es separada de su esposo, animada por una amiga empezó con la venta de productos de belleza, este trabajo es otro ingreso adicional que le permite cubrir algunas necesidades sobretodo los estudios de sus hijos, los productos que vende los ofrece entre sus vecinas, amigos y en su centro de trabajo a sus compañeras quiénes son sus potenciales clientas,  mas adelante quiere  poner un negocio más grande donde pueda ofrecer más variedad de productos. Ana  pertenece a la alcancía  LA FORTALEZA y el  préstamo que acaba de recibir le servirá para comprar variados artículos de belleza como perfumes, cremas y maquillaje. Así puede seguir progresando y cumplir las metas que tiene trazadas.

*Ana aparece en la parte superior de la derecha (foto pequeña).
texts.en: Ana is a private nurse and works in a home. She has 4 children and she works a lot for their sake in order to support them and give them a good education, since she is separated. On the advice of a friend, she started to sell beauty products: this gives her additional income with which to pay for necessities and especially for her children's education. She sells her products to neighbours, friends, and colleagues, who are potential clients. In the future, she would like to set up a bigger business where she would sell a greater variety of products. Ana belongs to communal bank La Fortaleza. With the loan she just received, she will buy various beauty products such as perfume, cream and make-up. Thus she will be able to move forward and achieve the objectives she set for herself. Ana is shown on the upper right (inset photo).

loans.use: to buy beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Joefrey

texts.en:
Joefrey, age 44, is a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Loleta, a housewife and mother to their four children. The family manages their own household while operating the business. Joefrey is working hard to provide income for their everyday expenses and to support his children’s schooling.

Joefrey operates a food stall where he sells fish balls, a common street food in the Philippines, which is served skewered and can be dipped in different sauces. Fish balls are somewhat flat in shape and are often made of cuttlefish. His other products include squid balls and quail eggs. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of Php 300 in sales every day.

To help him continue operations, he is requesting a Php 12,000 loan. He will use the loan to buy more fish ball products and other ingredients. He expects to increase his income as he expands the business.

Joefrey hopes to be able to expand soon, just as he fervently hopes that his children will be able to finish their studies. He faithfully meets with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God, which he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet weekly. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The groups gather to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fish ball products and other supplies needed in his business.

loans.name: Ilkin

texts.en: Ilkin is a 25-year-old man who studies at the Azerbaijan Technology University in the Standardizing and Technology Machines Department. He is now in his third year and is going to graduate in 2013. He is not working now because studying takes all his time. Hence, his parents pay for his education, especially his father. He would like to get an MBA and continue his education after finishing at the university, but first Ilkin needs to pay his tuition and for this purpose he has applied for a 2,000 AZN loan.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition.

loans.name: Misha

texts.en: Misha is involved in agriculture. He runs a farm where he cultivates potatoes, beans, and beech, and he breeds cattle. Misha's wife manages the household, and his son helps with farming. Misha needs money to cover the costs connected with the spring sowing. With the requested loan he will purchase potato and beech seeds and fertilizer. This will allow Misha to gather a rich harvest, which will help him not only to provide for the family, but also to sell more and earn more income.

loans.use: to pay for potato and beech seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila lives at Padul with her spouse and five children, two of whom are still attending to elementary education while the rest had to find their own employment already.

Her husband's business is farming while she is running a small store selling grocery items to the people in their village. She would like to improve her sales capacity, so she is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy sardines, biscuits, eggs, breads and shampoo to sell in her store.

Someday she hopes to keep making her small business more diversified with good income for the overall welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy sardines, biscuits, eggs, breads and shampoo to sell in her store

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a small entrepreneur in their village. She has a hog raising business which allows her to gain enough profits for her family. She is 49 years old and a widower. She has three children. Luckily, two of them work abroad in "greener pastures". Her youngest child is still in college. Sometimes her children abroad give remittances to her but she doesn't want to rely on them, so she still pursues her small business for profits. 

Now she would like to keep ensuring good nutrition of her hogs, so she is requesting for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for the hogs' sustainability. This will help the hogs grow healthier and she can offer them at a higher price upon disposal. 

With enough funds, Aida would like to renovate her pigpen and continuously grow as a successful hog raiser.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for the hogs' sustainability

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en:
Gagik lives in Yeghegnadzor town with his son. Gagik works as a taxi driver. Besides this, he keeps poultry.

Gagik wants to develop beekeeping, for which he needs some investments. With the help of this loan he plans to purchase 6 beehives. This will be a good start for Gagik in beekeeping. He has all the necessary conditions on his farm for beekeeping. Gagik is full of hope that he will succeed in this and it will soon be profitable for him.

loans.use: to pay for 6 beehives

loans.name: Hrachya

texts.en:
Hrachya is 36. He lives in Abovyan city with his family: wife, pensioner mother and 3-year-old daughter.

A few years ago, Hrachya started his busiess of trading in grain. He purchases differnet kinds of grain and sells in a few regions of the country.  In order to meet the increasing demand, Hrachya wants to purchase more grain. This will allow him to increse the sales and make his business more profitable.

loans.use: to pay for grain

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou lives at Padul with her spouse and four children. She decided to put up a hog raising business to add to her spouse's income derived from farming. They strive hard to meet the family's needs, especially for school expenses of their children.

She is now asking for a loan of 11,000 PHP to improve the growth of her hogs through feed, medicines and vaccines for sustainability. She promises to pay back this loan in full and hopes to keep generating good profit from the business. 

Marilou will be very happy and proud to see all her children with degrees and professionals in their chosen career someday.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicines and vaccines for hogs

loans.name: Arevik

texts.en:
Arevik lives in Masis village with her family: parents, 3 brothers and sister-in-law. The family is involved in agricultural works on the farm where they grow peach and apricot trees, cultivate vegetables in green houses and keep 30 beehives. The gathered harvest is sold at the local market.

Arevik needs sufficient investments to develop the farm. With the loan's help, she plans to purchase a cow, hives for the bees and pepper seeds. This will essentially increase the profit from agriculture, which is important for Arevik and her large family to cover their costs and live in better conditions.

loans.use: to pay for a cow, hives for the bees and pepper seeds

loans.name: María Elizabeth

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus hermosas playas, por su rica y variada gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Sociedad De Bahía.

La señora María es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos para salir adelante y mucho más después de la muerte de su esposo. Tiene 56  años de edad, es viuda pero  de esa relación tiene tres hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad pero uno de ellos aun viven con ella al igual que dos nietos de 18 y 12 años que los tiene desde pequeños y estudian en colegio y Universidad. 

Nuestra amiga para poder salir adelante y para darles lo necesario a sus hijos y nietos tuvo que dedicarse al comercio, ella tiene un pequeño comedor en su casa en el cual prepara deliciosos platos, trabaja todos los días desde las 06h00 hasta las  16h00, ella además de esto también vende ropa, zapatos, carteras, perfumes, entre otras cosas, vende en su local y en las tardes o noches sale a recorrer, sus nietos le ayuda en su negocio. Nos cuenta que tiene su comedor por  más de 30 años, desde que falleció su esposo y tuvo que hacerse cargo ella sola de su familia y gracias a Dios siempre le fue bien, después empezó con la venta de sus otros productos.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar ropa, zapatos, perfumes y víveres para la preparación de los alimentos.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y darles una buena educación a sus nietos.
texts.en:
In the beautiful city of Bahía de Caraquez, known for its beautiful beaches, for its rich and varied cuisine and for the warmth of its people, the communal bank Sociedad de Bahía meets twice a month.

María is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because they give loans in order to help her get ahead and much more after the death of her husband. She is 56 years old, a widow with three children who are all adults but one of them still lives with her along with two grandchildren living with her since they were little who are 18 and 12 years old, who are students at school and university.

Our friend, in order to get ahead and give what is necessary to her children and grandchildren, had to go into business. She has a small dining room in her home where she prepares delicious dishes, working every day from 6:00AM until 4:00PM. She also sells clothing, shoes, handbags, perfumes and other items. She sells at home and in the afternoons and evenings she travels about. Her grandchildren help her with the business. We note that she has had her dining room business for more than thirty years, since her husband died and she took over the sole care of the family and thanks to God she has always done well. Later she began selling other products. 

She is going to use this loan to buy clothes, shoes, perfumes, and provisions for the preparation of her dishes.

Her goals are to get ahead in her business and give her grandchildren a good education.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, perfumes, and provisions

loans.name: María Silvia

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus hermosas playas, por su rica y variada gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Sociedad De Bahía.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora  María, tiene 53 años de edad, es madre soltera de  un hijo el cual ya es mayor de edad e independiente. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le han brindado en todo este tiempo para salir adelante.

Nuestra amiga para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder salir adelante sola y sin tener que causar molestias a nadie se dedica a la venta de  productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Ella además de esto también elabora cojines, almohadas y sabanas para bebés con diferentes bordados y motivos, también para ganar algo extra prepara almuerzos de lunes a viernes pero solo para entregar, trabaja todos  los días en todas sus actividades ya que si no hace una cosa hace otra,  lleva más de 10 años con sus actividades y nos cuenta que es así como ha podido salir adelante ella sola.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y materiales para elaborar sus sabanas y almohadas.

Sus sueños son tener un gran taller y un bazar.
texts.en:
In the beautiful city of Bahía de Caraquez, known for its beautiful beaches, for its rich and varied cuisine and for the warmth of its people, the communal bank Sociedad de Bahía meets twice a month.

We meet here María who is 53 years old. She is a single mother of a son who is an independent adult. She has been with the communal bank since it began and she likes it because of the help it has given throughout that time to get ahead.

Our friend, in order to obtain her own resources and thereby be able to get ahead alone without having to inconvenience anyone, sells Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories for women). She also makes cushions, pillows, and sheets for babies with various embroidery and motifs. Also, in order to earn a bit more she prepares lunches from Monday through Fridays but only for delivery. She works every day at all her activities, at one thing or the other, doing these activities for more than ten years and she tells us that this is how she has been able to manage alone. 

This loan will be used to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and materials to make her sheets and pillows.

Her dreams are to have a large workshop and a bazaar.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, and materials to make sheets and pillows

loans.name: Sonia María

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus hermosas playas, por su rica y variada gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Sociedad De Bahía.

En este lugar vive la señora Sonia, tiene 36 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 19, 9, 6 y 4 años de edad los mismos que estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido es comerciante.
 
Nuestra amiga para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a una actividad comercial, ella tiene un pequeño comedor en el centro de la ciudad lugar que es alquilado y en el cual prepara deliciosos platos, trabaja todos los días desde las 09h00 hasta las  a las 19h00, ella prepara almuerzos y meriendas. Trabaja con la ayuda de su esposo cuando él está desocupado. Nos cuenta que tiene su comedor por dos años y que siempre le ha ido muy bien ya que sus clientes la prefieren por la sazón que le pone a sus platos, su especialidad son los mariscos.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 2 años  y le gusta porque gracias al primer crédito empezó su negocio y lo ha ido mejorando cada dia.
 
Su sueño es tener su propio local y así no tener que pagar arriendos.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days, the members of the the Communal Bank of the Bay Society come together in the beautiful city of Bahía De Caraquez, known for its lovely beaches, its rich and varied cuisine and the warmth of its people.

Sonia, who is 36 and lives in a domestic partnership, lives there.  She has four children who are 19, 9, 6 and 4 years old.  They are all in school or high school.  Her husband is a businessman.

Sonia works so that she can help her husband with household expenses.  She has a small restaurant in the city center which she rents and where she prepares delicious dishes.  She works every day from 9 a.m. until 7 p.m.  She prepares both lunches and snacks.  Her spouse helps out when he is unemployed.  She has had her restaurant for two years and it has always done very well because her clients like the way she seasons the food.  Her specialty is seafood.

She will use this loan to buy rice, meat, fish and other provisions for cooking.  She has been in the Communal Bank for two years.  She loves it because her first loan enabled her to start her business and things have been improving for her ever since.

Her dream is to own her own place and not have to pay rent.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, fish and other provisions.

loans.name: Sofia Del Rosario

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus hermosas playas, por su rica y variada gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Sociedad De Bahía.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Sofía, tiene 50 años de edad, está soltera y vive en casa de sus padres. Lleva cinco años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son de gran ayuda y los intereses son muy bajos.

Nuestra amiga trabaja como empleada publica, pero además de esto también vende ropa, zapatos, carteras y bisutería, nos cuenta que aprovecha para vender en su lugar de trabajo o en sus ratos libres y por la noches cuando tiene tiempo,  ella deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días, compra su mercadería en Guayaquil cuando necesita, es así como desde hace 25 años empezó su negocio y es con esto que ella sale adelante y puede ayudar a sus padres los cuales ya están ancianos.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar ropa, zapatos, carteras, bisutería entre otras cosas. 

Sus metas son seguir adelante y comprar un carro para realizar sus recorridos.
texts.en:
In the beautiful city of Bahía de Caraquez, known for its beautiful beaches, for its rich and varied cuisine and for the warmth of its people, the communal bank Sociedad de Bahía meets twice a month.

We meet here Sofía, who is 50 years old. She is single and lives at home with her parents. She has been with the communal bank for five years and she likes it because the loans are a big help and the interest is very low.

Our friend works as as public employee, but she also sells clothing, shoes, handbags and costume jewelry. She tells us that she sells her items at her workplace and in her free time and at night when she has time she drops off items on credit and collects payment twice a month, buying her merchandise in Guayaquil when she needs to. She is able to help her parents who are elderly. 

This loan will be used to buy clothing, shoes, handbags and costume jewelry among other items.

Her goals are to get ahead and to buy a car for her traveling sales work.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, handbags, and costume jewelry

loans.name: Angeli

texts.en:
This is Angeli, 30, resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Ricky, a baker, and mother to their two children. She, with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Angeli operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil or an egg. Angeli earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. 

Aside from the variety store, she has a bake shop where different types of pastries and bread are sold. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,270 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 35,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory and to pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her bakeshop. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Angeli hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes to have her own house and lot. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Carlota Elena

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus hermosas playas, por su rica y variada gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Sociedad De Bahía.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Carlota, tiene 61 años, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos, los mismos que ya son mayores de edad,  dos de ellos  aun vive con ella. Su esposo es mecánico.

Nuestra amiga  es una muy buena ama de casa que para colaborar con los gastos que genera el hogar se dedica a preparar y vender bocadillos y comida rápida, ella todas las mañanas instala su pequeño kiosco por un Centro Comercial de esta preciosa ciudad y ofrece bolones con queso o chicharrón, tortillas de maíz, salchichas y plátano asado que son muy apetecidas por sus clientes todo esto acompañados de café o jugos a preferencia de sus clientes. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 14h00 y lleva más de 30 años con su negocio el cual le ha dejado muchas satisfacciones ya que gracias a esto pudo ayudar a sus hijos con sus estudios.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar aceite, plátano, salchichas y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos.
 
Su sueño es tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days the members of the Communal Bank of the Bay Society come together in the beautiful city of Bahía De Caraquez, known for its lovely beaches, the richness and diversity of its cuisine, and the warmth of its residents.

One member, Carlota, is 61 and married with four children, who are now adults.  Two of her children still live with her.  Her husband is a mechanic.

Carlota is a very good housewife who helps with household expenses.  She makes and sells sandwiches and fast food.  Every morning, she sets up a small kiosk in this appealing city's commercial center and sells  sandwich meats with cheese or pork, corn tortillas, sausages and grilled plantains, all of which are very much sought after by her clients.  All of this is accompanied by coffee or juice according to her clients' preferences.

She works every day from 6 a.m. until 2 p.m.  She has worked in this business for more than thirty years.  It has given her great satisfaction because it helped her put her children through school.

Carlota will use loan proceeds to buy oil, bananas, sausages, and other provisions for preparing food.  She is a new member of the Communal Bank and she likes it because they give loans.

Her dream is to own a large restaurant.

loans.use: to buy oil, bananas, sausages and other provisions.

loans.name: Luisa Andina

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus hermosas playas, por su rica y variada gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Sociedad De Bahía.

En este lugar vive la señora Luisa, tiene 54 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos, todos mayores de edad e independientes. El marido es comerciante.
 
Nuestra amiga junto al esposo tienen una tienda de comestibles en el mercado de la localidad, allí venden todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas, además de ciertos productos de bazar y papelería, helados, tarjetas y recargas telefónicas.  Trabajan todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 18h00, ella además por las noches y en su local también vende productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Tienen más de 30 años su tienda, razón por la cual son muy conocidos y su clientela  es muy grande.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, útiles escolares, productos de bazar, entre otros productos de primera necesidad. Está desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le han facilitado las cosas.

Su meta es seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
In the beautiful city of Bahía de Caraquez, known for its beautiful beaches, for its rich and varied cuisine and for the warmth of its people, the communal bank Sociedad de Bahía meets twice a month.

Here we meet Luisa, who is 54 years old and has a relationship from which she has three children, all of them independent adults. Her husband is a businessman.

Our friend and her husband have a grocery store in the local market. There they sell all types of products such as rice, sugar, oils, detergents, vegetables, fruits, and other consumer products and stationery, ice creams, cards and telephone recharges. They work from 6:00AM until 6:00PM. In the evenings she also sells Yanbal (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and accessories for women). She has been working more than 30 years in her store and this is the reason she is well known and has a big clientele base.

This loan is going to be used to supply her store. She is going to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, school products, consumer products, among other staples. She has been with the communal bank since its beginning and she likes it because the loans have made things easier.

Her goal is to get ahead in her business and that her store grows every day.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, school supplies, consumer products, and other staples

loans.name: Hope

texts.en:
This is Hope, 42, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Joebert, an Overseas Filipino Worker, and she is mother to their three children. She manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Hope operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Hope earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 600 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 24,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
 
Hope hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes to give her children a quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Ashot lives in Jermuk town with his wife, Esmina, and his daughter, Mari. Ashot's son serves in the army at present. 

For many years, Ashot has been involved in beekeeping, which has been the main source of income for his family. Currently Ashot keeps 18 beehives.
 
Ashot would like to develop his beekeeping business, for which he needs sufficient means. With the requested loan, he plans to purchase nine beehives. 

Ashot wants to provide access to higher education for his children. Development of beekeeping is important for him to make savings for this purpose.

loans.use: to pay for nine beehives.

loans.name: Altan

texts.en:
Altan is 18. He is student of the first year of Azerbaijan Technology University. He studies on the faculty of  Manufacturing Product and Expertise and his study years are 2011-2015. 

He is not working, because study in the university takes all his time. Only his father is working in the family and his family did not expect that Altan would enter a paid faculty. But after school, his test scores were not high enough to get an education free of charge. 

To pay the first two years, Altan applied for a 1,700 AZN loan. His dream is to start working as soon as he feels that he can compound his education and work without any losses.

loans.use: to pay for university education.

loans.name: Grey María

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus hermosas playas, por su rica y variada gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Sociedad De Bahía.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Grey, tiene 55 años de edad, está divorciada pero de esa  relación tiene cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad e independientes.

Nuestra amiga con la intención de ganar su sustento  y con esto poder salir adelante sola y no tener que depender de nadie se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y géneros,  su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos, nos cuenta que la mayor parte de sus ventas son bajo pedido, trabaja todos los días deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite. Tiene 11 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace  11 años  y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio que hoy le permite ganarse la vida.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante y tener muy buena salud.
texts.en:
In the scenic city of Bahía De Caraquez, known for its beautiful beaches, its rich and diverse cuisine and the warmth of its people, the members of the "Sociedad De Bahía" communal bank meet every fifteen days. 

Here we meet Grey, who is 55 years old. She is divorced, but from this relationship she has four children. All of them are grown and independent. 

With the intention of earning a living, so that she can get ahead on her own and not have to depend on anyone, our friend dedicates herself to commerce. She sells clothing of all types for both genders. Her sales method is door to door, and she also sells from her home to her most familiar customers. She reports that the majority of her sales are in response to orders. She works every day. She allows her customers to pay on credit, and she collects payments every fifteen days. She goes to Guayaquil to buy her merchandise every fifteen days or once a month, according to her needs. She has dedicated herself to this work for 11 years, and it is going very well for her. 

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise, such as pants, blouses, shirts and children's clothing. She has been in the communal bank for 11 years, and she likes it because with the first loan, she started her business, which today allows her to earn a living. 
 
Her dreams are to keep going and to have very good health.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, shirts and children's clothing to sell.

loans.name: María Elizabeth

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus hermosas playas, por su rica y variada gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Sociedad De Bahía.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, tiene 65  años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció  pero  de esa relación tienen cinco hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad, una de sus hijas vive en su casa. Para ella este es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y está muy contenta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos.

Nuestra amiga es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder salir adelante se dedica a la venta de productos para el hogar como planchas, camas, ventiladores, ollas, entre otras cosas, además de productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja casi todos los días, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días, por lo cual además de vender tiene que salir a cobrar lo que entrega. Tiene cuatro años que se dedica a esta actividad y gracias a  esto ha podido salir adelante sin tener que pedirles a sus hijos ni a nadie comenta.

Este crédito es para comprar artículos para el hogar si como también perfumes, cremas, cosmético, entre otras cosas.
 
Su sueño es tener un gran almacén.
texts.en:
In the beautiful city of Bahía De Caraquez, known for its beautiful beaches, delicious and varied gastronomy, and for the warmth of its people, the members of the communal bank Sociedad De Bahía meet every fifteen days.

In this place we meet María who's 65 years old. Several years ago her husband died but from this relationship they had five children which are already older. One of her daughters lives in her home. For her, this is the third loan cycle with the communal bank and she is very happy because of the help that the loans have given her.

Our friend is a housewife that makes a living selling household products like irons, beds, fans, and pots, among other items, as well as Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumery, and women's' accessories) to obtain her own resources and with these be able to get ahead. She works almost every day, sells her products on credit, and collects money every eight days. Because of this, in addition to making sales, she has to go out to collect money on what she sells. She has been making a living doing this for four years and thanks to this she has been able to get ahead without having to ask her children nor anyone else for help, she says.

This loan is for the purchase of household items like perfume, lotion, and cosmetics, among other things.

Her dream is a have a large store.

loans.use: to buy household items like perfumes, lotions, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: El Mar Y Sol  (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En la ciudadela San Gregorio  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las 15 socias y los 2 socios del Banco Comunal El Mar y Sol. Los cuales que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio en general, servicios, entre otras cosas.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Delia, tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 18, 14 y 12 años de edad, los menores estudian en colegio. Su esposo trabaja ocasionalmente.

Nuestra amiga es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar ya que él no tiene un trabajo estable se dedica a la venta de ropa y productos de Esika (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas  diarias, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, nos cuenta que lo que más vende son los perfumes, en esta época se vende mucho y espera aprovechar las ofertas que ofrecen las empresas con las que trabaja y así ganar más.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa. Este es el segundo  ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan tanto a ella como a sus compañeros.

Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos, que ellos sean profesionales y salgan adelante.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days in the Saint Gregory Citadel located in the city of Portoviejo, fifteen female members and two male members of The Sea and Sun Communal Bank come together.  They are engaged in diverse occupations including general commerce, services, and more.

One member, Delia, is 44 years old and married with three children, who are 18, 14, and 12.  The youngest two are in high school.  Her husband works occasionally.  Delia is a housewife who started working to be able to make her own money and help out her spouse, who doesn't have a stable job, with household expenses.  She sells clothes and Esika products (beauty poducts, cosmetics, perfume and accessories for women).  She works three day a week for two or three hours a day.  She leaves the goods on credit and collects payment every eight days.  Delia has been working in this capacity for four years and is doing very well.  Perfumes are the best sellers.  Currently she is making a lot of sales and hopes to be able to take advantage of deals offered by her partner companies and thereby increase earnings.

This loan wil be used to buy perfumes, beauty creams, cosmetics and clothing.  This is her second loan with the Communal Bank and she likes being a member for the help given to her and to her peers.

Her dream is to provide the best for her children so that they can become professionals and be successful.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, beauty creams, cosmetics and clothing.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is 31. He lives in Ejmiatsin town with his parents, wife and children. 

Artur is involved in agriculture. He grows vegetables and fruit trees and raises cattle. 

Unable to find enough funds to develop agriculture, Artur has applied for this loan. With the requested amount he plans to purchase cattle. This will help Artur increase his profit. 

Artur plans to construct a greenhouse where he will be able to grow vegetables all year. Additional income will give Artur opportunity to reach this goal.

loans.use: to pay for cattle.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is 43. She lives with her husbnad, daughter and mother-in-law. Anahit is a nurse, but besides, she is involved in agricultural work on the family farm, where they keep beehives. Anahit sells the honey in Kapan city.

Anahit wants to renew the old hives for the bees, which will allow her to create better conditions for development of beekeeping. This loan is important to gather more honey and earn more income.

loans.use: to pay for beehives.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit lives in the Agarak community with her son. 

Anahit is involved in cattle breeding. She would like to develop her farm, but her current income does not allow her to save to reach this aim. 

Anahit has applied for this loan to purchase 17 young pigs and food for them. This will support Anahit to earn more income, improve conditions in her household and provide a better future for her son.

loans.use: to pay for 17 pigs and forage.

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush lives with her parents and brother. For many years the family has been involved in agriculture: land cultivation and cattle breeding.  

Because of unfavorable weather conditions, Anush’s family wasn‘t able to have enough profit to save for agriculture this year. So Anush has applied for this loan to get sufficient funds. 

With the loan’s help she will purchase seeds, fertilizer and increase the number of cattle. This will provide more income for Anush’s family during the year, which will help them to meet their needs and save to invest in the farm next year.

loans.use: to pay for cattle, seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine lives with her husband and two children. 

The family gathers the main part of its income from cattle breeding and land cultivating. 

Armine needs sufficient funds to start and successfully finish the land cultivation. With the loan’s help, she plans to purchase seeds, fertilizer and fuel. This will allow Armine to expect a good harvest, which will provide additional income for Armine and her family.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fertilizer and fuel.

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush lives in Shikahogh village with her husband and two sons. Anush and her husband work at the village school. Besides, they are also involved in agriculture, which is the main source of income for the family. 

Anush and her husband breed cattle. Their sons help with daily agricultural activities. Anush makes cheese from the milk and sells it in the regional center, Kapan city. Anush would like to develop sheep breeding, for which she wants to purchase 17 sheep. With the loan's help, Anush will also purchase fuel to take the cheese to the city.
 
This loan is important for Anush and her family, as she will earn more income. She dreams for her sons to start their own families and live prosperous lives. With additional income she will be able to support her family.

loans.use: to pay for 17 sheep and fuel.

loans.name: Anzhela

texts.en:
Anzhela lives in Berkanush village with her son. 

Since 1999, Anzhela and her husband have run a farm, where she grows fruits and vegetables in three greenhouses. Anzhela has created all the necessary conditions to gather good harvests, which she sells at the local market. 

Anzhela wants to purchase tomato seeds, medicine and fertilizer. She also plans to renovate her greenhouses and create better conditions for farming.

Development of farming is vital for Anzhela to have a stable income and create prosperous living conditions for her son.

loans.use: to pay for tomato seeds, fertilizer, medicine and greenhouse renovation.

loans.name: Xetrubala Dos Group

texts.es:
La señora Carmen es casada, tiene 36 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 5 hijos 1 de los cuales esta estudiando, se dedica a actividades pecuarias, a la crianza de cerdos, inició su actividad económica, sembrando hortalizas y la crianza de gallinas ponedoras, hasta el momento lleva 11 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizaran para  la compra de cerdos, en el futuro quiere contar con una granja. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedica a la crianza de ganado, crianza de cerdos y crianza de gallina.
texts.en:
Carmen is married, 36, and didn't have an opportunity to study. She has five children, one of which is studying. She works in agricultural activities, raising pigs. She started farming vegetables and raising laying hens. So far, she has 11 years of experience. 

She organized a group to request a loan for buying pigs. In the future, she wants to have a farm. The other group members raise cattle, pigs, and hens.

loans.use: to buy pigs and pig feed.

loans.name: Juan Basilio

texts.es:
El señor Juan Basilio es originario del municipio de Achuapa donde ha vivido toda su vida, es un señor responsable dedicado a su familia que se esmera por llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar y darles lo mejor que puede a sus pequeños hijos.
Se dedica a laborar como maestro de primaria donde tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad, lo que le ha permitido tener su propia vivienda y llevar el sustento a su hogar.
Tiene dos años de trabajar con Ceprodel donde le han otorgado tres créditos todos para gastos personales, lo que agradece este apoyo por brindarles la confianza y que les ayuda a resolver problemas personales.
En este momento tiene la necesidad de adquirir un préstamo para comprar una vaquilla y dos rollos de alambre con el fin de ir aumentando su hato ganadero y cercar si finca.
texts.en:
Juan Basilio is from the municipality of Achuapa where he has lived all his life. He is a responsible, family-oriented man who does his best to bring back money to his home every day and give his young children the best he can provide. 

He works as a school teacher and has many years of experience in this field, which has enabled his to have his own home and support his household.

He has been working with Ceprodel for two years where they have granted him three loans, all for personal spending, what makes him thankful for this support is the trust they put in him, and that they have helped him to resolve personal problems. 

This time, Juan Basilio needs a loan to buy a heifer and two reels of wire with the aim of increasing his cattle herd and fence off his land.

loans.use: to buy a heifer and two reels of wire.

loans.name: Parviz

texts.en:
Parviz is a 19-year-old student of Azerbaijan Technology University. He is taking his first year of education in the faculty of Manufacturing Product and Expertise. 

He is not working and his father and mother have already paid for the first year of education. Parviz`s father lost his job recently and Parviz took a loan to pay the education fee for the second and third year. He applied for 1,400 AZN.  

The main advantage of loan is that it will be easier to pay by his family and that in Azerbaijan, next year's fees have to be paid a year in advance.

loans.use: to pay tuition fee for university.

loans.name: Loem

texts.en:
Loem is 51 years old and married. He has five children, two of whom are under his care and they work at the family's business. 

He and his wife have been planting maize and rice as the family's main source of income for more than ten years. The main challenges for his family's business are flood and drought. 

Loem has received three loans from VisionFund and he successfully paid back all the loans. The past loans have helped his family make a living better and afford sufficient food. With his current business, he is able to earn 20,000 KHR per day. 

With a good business, he is applying for a fourth loan with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. He will use this loan to buy fertilizer for his farmland and use a portion of it to spend for labor. He hopes this loan will enable him to increase family's income so he can afford to extend the farmland and have a decent house for living in.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay for labor.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
A rural villager in the Ek Phnom district, Sara is thirty-two-years old and married with two daughters. To make a living, he and his wife have been farming rice and beans on 1.5 hectares of farmland. This is the family's main source of income. He also gains extra income by spice planting and construction. He has been in this business for five years. The main challenge for him is fruitless rice and unhealthy crops. Through his hard work in his current businesses, he is able to earn around 130,000 KHR per day and can save around 30,000 KHR each day. 

This is the first loan for Sara with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. He is now applying for a loan with VisionFund to buy a motorbike to use for his construction business. This loan will enable Sara to expand his construction business to other areas so as to increase family's income and make a better living.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to use in his construction business.

loans.name: Eveline

texts.en: Eveline is a twenty-five-year-old married woman with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling bananas for one and half years. Her hardships are price fluctuation and perishability of the bananas. Her personal goal is building a permanent house to reside in, and her business goal is to move her business to a more permanent location. Eveline wants money to buy bananas to sell.

loans.use: to buy bananas to sell.

loans.name: Hashim

texts.en:
Hashim is a forty-year-old married man with two children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has a retail shop which he has operated for three years and this has allowed him to provide basic necessities for the family.

Price fluctuation and inadequate capital are the main hardships he is facing however his personal goals are to educate his children, build a permanent house and go back to school for further studies. His business goals are to buy land to grow crops and move his business to more permanent location.

Hashim wants the loan is to buy general merchandise such as soap and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Beatriz Marlene

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus hermosas playas, por su rica y variada gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Sociedad De Bahía.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Beatriz, tiene 28 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 12, 10, 9 y 8 años de edad, todos estudian en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante y en temporadas se dedica a la pesca.

Nuestra amiga junto al  esposo se dedican al comercio, ellos  tienen un pequeño local en el centro de la ciudad lugar en el cual venden todo tipo de accesorios y repuestos telefónicos, tarjetas y recargas telefónicas. Allí  Trabajan todos los días.  Nos cuenta que llevan en este negocio por más de 4 años y que les va muy bien. En temporadas su esposo sale a pescar junto con otras personas, tiempo en el cual trabaja sola, ellos comprar la mercadería en la ciudad de Guayaquil.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar tarjetas, repuestos y accesorios telefónicos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 4 años y le gusta porque con los créditos han aumentado el negocio.

Su sueño es tener un local más grande y surtido.
texts.en:
In the beautiful city of Bahía De Caraquez, known for its beautiful beaches, for its rich and varied gastronomy and for the quality of its people, the members of the Sociedad de Bahía communal bank meet every fortnight. It is in this place that we encounter Beatriz, who is 28 years old, married and with four children from this relationship aged 12, 10, 9 and 8, all of whom study at school. Her husband is a shopkeeper and in fishing seasons, he works as a fisherman.

Our friend works in sales along with her husband. They have a small shop in the city center where they sell all types of phone accessories and spare parts, cards and phone top-up cards. They work there every day. They tell us that they have been in this business for more than four years and that it is going very well. In fishing season, her husband goes fishing with other people, during which time she works alone. They purchase their goods in the city of Guayaquil. 

She will use this loan to buy telephone cards, spare parts and accessories. She has been part of the Communal Bank for four years, and she likes it because the loans have helped her to grow the business. Her dream is to have a larger, better stocked store.

loans.use: to buy phone cards, spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Jostine

texts.en: Jostine is a forty-eight-year old married woman who has four children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been operating a bar for thirteen years. Her hardships are high fuel costs, inadequate capital to purchase stock, and lack of electricity. Personal goals are educating children and building a permanent home, while her business goal is expanding her bar and buying a generator. Jostine wants money to buy sodas and beers to sell.

loans.use: to buy sodas and beers to sell.

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en: Emmy is a thirty-two-year old married man who has three children living in Kasese, Uganda.  He has been a photographer for ten years  He started the business with the savings of his pocket money given to him while still at school.  His hardships are inadequate capital to set up a modern studio, and long distances traveled to get to customers.  Personal goals are educating children, buying a car and building a permanent home.  Business goals are setting up a photo studio and expanding business into new markets.  Emmy wants money to buy a camera.

loans.use: to buy a camera

loans.name: Fausto De Jesús

texts.es:
El señor Fausto tiene 63 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo. Él proviene de una familia muy numerosa, tiene ocho hermanos y él es el único varón, por lo que desde muy temprana edad empezó a trabajar con su papá en la siembra agrícola. A sus 25 años de edad se caso y desde entonces inicio a trabajar él solo, hoy en día trabaja con el esposo de su hija y sus nietos.

Los insumos agrícolas los compra en dos ciudades que están una a seis kilómetros de su casa y la otra a dos kilómetros de distancia. Luego debe pagar un medio de trasporte para trasladar los insumos a su casa y posteriormente paga otro medio de trasporte que es una carreta para llevarlos de su casa hasta el terreno donde tiene sus cultivos que esta a nueve kilómetros.

Don Fausto solicita el préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar abono, fertilizantes, insecticidas, para la preparación de la tierra donde cultivara. Así él tendrá una fuente de ingresos para ayudar a su familia con una mayor producción. Su deseo es el mejorar su vivienda, para que su hija le brinde una mejor vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sr. Fausto is 63 years old, married and has one daughter. He comes from a very large family and has eight siblings. He is the only male so that at a very early age he began working with his father in the fields. At 25 years of age he married and began working on his own. Nowadays he works with his daughter’s husband and his grandchildren.

He buys his agricultural supplies in two cities; one is six kilometers from his house and the other two kilometers away.  Therefore he needs to pay for a means of transportation to bring the supplies to his house and later pay for more transport, which is a wagon, to take them from his house to the field where he has his crops. His land is nine kilometers from his house.

Don Fausto is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo to purchase compost, fertilizer, and insecticide in order to prepare the land he cultivates. Thus he will have a source of income to help his family with a major production. His desire is to improve his dwelling so that his daughter can provide a better life for her children.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizer and insecticides to prepare the land he cultivates.

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.en:
Ruslan is a twenty-three-year-old man. He is a student in the last year of his studies at Azerbaijan Technology University. He is studying Food Products, Technology and Tourism and is working at the same time. He is a very independent and task-oriented young man with ambitions. He is working in a local company and his monthly income is 200 AZN. 

Ruslan wants to pay for his final year at university and this is why he has applied for a loan of 1,400 AZN.

loans.use: to pay the fees for his last year at university.

loans.name: Asuman

texts.en:
Asuman is a thirty-eight-year-old married man with two children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has a retail shop that he has operated for three years and the business is still profitable despite challenges including price fluctuations, inadequate capital, customers not paying on time and theft. He has personal goals of educating his children and building a permanent house while his business goals are to hire employees to help expand his business and diversifying his business to include transport.

The purpose of the loan is to buy a new motorcycle for a transport business.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle for a transport business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a house for his residence.

loans.name: Fatima Maria

texts.es: En el municipio de Telica en un poblado del  departamento de león, la señora Fátima se dedica arduamente  a laborar como Auxiliar de Enfermería  en un centro de salud de la localidad,   dedicándose a esta labor desde hace 23 años, es casada con 1 hijo   a su cargo a los  que tiene que proporcionarles  las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrollen, Una de las necesidades que la señora Fátima atraviesa es de Mejorar su Salud, como es el tratamiento médico, El que necesita para mantenerse en forma activa  para tener mejores condiciones y nivel de vida, para ella y su familia, ya que debido a esta necesidad, le `permitió tomar la decisión de visitar a ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para el tratamiento antes mencionado.
texts.en: In the town of Telica, in a village in the department of León, Fátima works hard as a nursing assistant in a neighborhood health center. She has been doing this work for 23 years. She is married with one child in her care and she provides his daily childhood needs. One of Fátima’s necessities is to improve her health. She needs medical treatment. She needs to be actively involved in supporting herself in order to have a better quality of life, for her and her family, and due to this need, she has permitted herself to take the decision to visit Cepordel in order to ask for a loan to be used in the treatment mentioned previously.

loans.use: to pay for medical treatment, to buy medicine, to pay for medical exams and consulting fees

loans.name: Yonatan

texts.en:
Yonatan is a 51 year-old man and has 5 children from his marriage. The children are: Willy, 29; Rion, 23;  Brian, 22; Richard, 13 and Giovani, 9. Willy, Rion and Brian have graduated from junior high school, while Richard and Giovani are still attending secondary and primary School. Yonatan generates money for his family by running a poultry business. He has been involved in the business for years. He gets the chicks and fodder supplies from a poultry shop and raises them for about a month before selling. 

Yonatan is planning to initiate a pig breeding business to help him generate more income. Therefore, he is requesting a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 5,000,000.  This loan enables him to pay for 4 piglets and fodder, and to build a small cage. He is expecting to generate extra income for his beloved family through the loan.

loans.use: to buy four piglets and fodder, and to build a small cage for the piglets

loans.name: Marceline

texts.en: Merceline is a 38-year-old married woman with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been teaching for fourteen years and is so proud of her profession because she feels that inspiring the young is her calling. Her personal goal is educating her children, and she intends to set up a poultry project to supplement her meager salary. Merceline wants money to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 64-year-old married man with thirteen children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has a retail shop, which he has operated for 37 years. He started the shop with savings from the salary he earned while working as a teacher. High fuel rates, customers not paying on time, and inadequate capital to run the business are the main hardships he is facing because he no longer teaches. However, his personal goal is to educate his children and build a permanent house, and his business goals are to hire employees to help him expand the business and to move the business to a more permanent location. 

Hassan intends to use the loan to pay university tuition for his last-born child.
